postings.text: Senior Software Engineer - Node.js Platform
postings.description:
About Netflix:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

About the Team:
We are the Node.js Platform team, and we are champions for front-end and UI teams at Netflix. Our mission is to empower them to easily create applications, services, and libraries through end-to-end curated experiences. We help them focus on innovation by reducing the complexity of building and operating software. We shepherd and evolve the Node.js vision at Netflix.

Collaboration is core to our team's identity. We work closely with our customers to build use-case-oriented solutions. We work closely with our partners to ensure that the Node.js runtime, frameworks, and libraries integrate well with the Netflix ecosystem. We work closely with the Node.js community to evolve the Node.js insights and diagnostics tools to operate at Netflix scale. 

We believe in pushing the abstraction boundaries. Our team provides a serverless Node.js platform that enables engineers to easily develop and deploy code that meets Netflix's availability, observability, and reliability needs. This mission-critical platform powers Netflix.com, the API services consumed by Netflix devices, and an ecosystem of web applications that support our content production. We continually invest in building operationally excellent systems that ensure Netflix delivers an incredible experience to our members around the world.

Our technologies are used by hundreds of engineers. We believe in delivering developer happiness throughout the software development experience. We define our success by our ability to accelerate productivity across Netflix engineering.

About the Role

  • This role will involve a mix of library and framework development, performance, production diagnostics and debugging, operations, and developer engagement and support.  You'll have countless chances to grow your expertise and experience on a number of axes with teammates that will support you throughout your journey.
  • Deeply understand how developers use Node.js at Netflix to create the optimal solutions and abstractions for their use cases and to help drive and evolve recommended practices
  • Collaborate with teams internally and in the Node.js community to shepherd and evolve the Node.js vision at Netflix
  • Provide and integrate the libraries, frameworks, and workflows that enable developers to build their Node.js software within the Netflix cloud ecosystem
  • Build, optimize, and scale our serverless platform and infrastructure
  • Continuously improve operational excellence through a culture of learning and ongoing, proactive investments in reliability and resiliency
  • Ensure full observability and real-time analytics into the state of Node.js services
  • Help define and improve the dependency management, packaging, and publishing story for Node.js
  • Identify and address patterns in the application runtime that make it harder for developers to productively build and maintain their software
  • Address complex architectural problems with simple, intuitive designs
  • Drive adoption of new technology into existing complex systems
More about us
Check out the Netflix Culture Memo to learn more about our unique culture. You can also hear directly from members of the team:

OpenJS World 2021: Package Vulnerability Management & Reporting Collaboration Space - Wes Todd
Future of Node.js HTTP High-Level API Design (Github) - Wes Todd
What sort of considerations do you make when you think about Netflix scale? #AskANetflixEngineer - Alex Liu

postings.text: Senior Product Designer (UX) - Data Experience
postings.description:
About Netflix:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

About the team:
The Data Experience team provides powerful and personalized enterprise software for internal teams doing data discovery, creation, and visualization. Our product packages Netflix’s data services into a cohesive experience for users and strives to enable data-driven decision-making in all aspects of our business. We focus on user-centered product delivery and prioritize features that enhance the productivity of our colleagues; indexing on connectivity, trust, innovation, and reliability. We value progress, avoid unnecessary processes, and require strong decision-making from each member of the team.

Our team includes people of different gender identities, parents, the self-taught, the university-educated, and people of a wide variety of nationalities, ages, and socio-economic backgrounds. Diverse teams are strong teams, and we encourage those with varied identities, backgrounds, and experiences to apply.

What You Will Do:

  • Solve big and complex problems while unearthing things that others might miss
  • Exhibit exceptional communication & presentation skills
  • Multitask and independently manage your own priorities to work fast and deliver
  • Work closely with stakeholders to understand and diagnose symptoms
  • Demonstrate tremendous visual and UX architectural design skills 
  • Synthesize complicated workflows and make them manageable
  • Become best friends with engineers (or at least love working with them)
  • Understand technology constraints and propose realistic, attainable solutions
  • Be humble, seek to understand different perspectives, and aren’t afraid to fail

Your Background Should Include:

  • A portfolio demonstrating measurably effective designs and problem solving
  • Ability to create detailed wireframes and design specs of intricate user flows
  • Expert skills in design and prototyping tools (Figma, Sketch, Invision) 
  • Experience working closely with engineers to deliver browser-based software products
  • Experience working on consumer and enterprise products over multiple release cycles
  • Experience leading, facilitating, and synthesizing user research
  • Experience presenting product and feature launches to audiences large and small

Even Better If You Have:

  • Experience with HTML, CSS, Javascript
  • Prior experience designing or working with data and data visualization tools

postings.text: Senior Data Scientist - Infrastructure Data Science and Engineering
postings.description:
Netflix is enjoyed by more than 200 million households globally, entertaining new audiences every day.  Netflix’s cloud platforms and internal tools play a key role in making the Netflix experience great.  We are one of the pioneers of leveraging a highly scalable cloud footprint to deliver delightful experiences to our members worldwide. The Infrastructure Data Science and Engineering team leads the analytic innovation that enables architecting secure, scalable, and efficient platforms. We partner with our internal engineering teams to empower them through intelligent analytic products and integrated models that enable smarter decision making. 

Our team currently has 4 pods, and a successful candidate would have the opportunity to work across any of these areas:

Platform Innovation - focuses on large initiatives within the platform engineering org focused on human efficiency and reduced complexity enabling engineers and scientists to do their best and most innovative work. Our main partners in this space are the Productivity Engineering teams which provide the platforms to build, deploy, and run the jobs, services, and applications that enable the Netflix product (and internal products like studio and finance tools, and data products).
Platform Scale - focuses on enabling our platform to scale efficiently to support new business areas as well as position ourselves to be able to reach 100s of millions of new members as the Netflix business grows around the world. We look for innovative ways to help the platform grow and scale for our needs.
Security - focuses on keeping the Netflix service secure for our members as well as securing our corporate infrastructure for employees and contractors. 
Core DSE - is a software engineering heavy group which builds tooling for the Netflix Data community, enabling them to more effectively focus on business problems rather than boiler plate work needed to build, develop and deploy software at Netflix. 

We are looking for a Senior Data Scientist who can develop a deep understanding of our engineering infrastructure product space and implement reliable and novel data models, algorithms, and practices that increase the capabilities, efficiency, and impact of the Netflix infrastructure.  As part of this team, you will innovate in the infrastructure space and deliver value to the business by optimizing practices at the platform layer.  

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in statistics, machine learning, data science or similar, sound software engineering skills, great and demonstrable data intuition, and share our passion for continuously improving the ways we use data to make the Netflix infrastructure better. 

Who you are:

  • Passionate about intuitive data models and an expert in the area of statistics and/or machine learning
  • Experienced in building data models that describe large scale data sets 
  • Fluent in multiple languages such as SQL, R, Python (or other similar languages)
  • Strong Software Engineering chops
  • Understand algorithmic trade-offs through years of experience and synthesis of past work or academic research
  • Excel at taking vague requirements and crystallizing them into scalable data solutions 
  • Excited about operating independently, demonstrating excellence, and learning new technologies and frameworks 
  • Able to effectively communicate with experts from different backgrounds and build strong partnerships
  • Comfortable presenting your insights and outcomes to all levels of the company and external collaborators or at conferences

Some bonus attributes:

  • A passion for Cloud Infrastructure, Productivity tooling, Application Security, and/or Information Security
  • Deep statistical skills utilized in A/B testing and analyzing observational data
  • Past technical leadership experience

What you will do:

  • Expertly handle structured and unstructured data 
  • Lead the design, analysis, and implementation of data models and algorithms that help shape infrastructure decisions
  • Support cutting edge experimentation methodologies
  • Develop subject-matter expertise in the infrastructure domain at Netflix 
  • Act as a thought partner to engineering teams; understand their challenges, and make opinionated recommendations that empower them with data to efficiently scale Netflix infrastructure and tools 
  • Perform data exploration to seed hypotheses and identify opportunities
  • Maintain and rethink existing data solutions to service a wider variety of use cases 
  • Join a stunning team of data experts with diverse skill set, and contribute to Netflix Research by developing new methodologies that could enhance our decision-making process

A few more things to know: 
Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about Netflix at jobs.netflix.com/culture. You will need to be comfortable working in the most agile of environments. Requirements will be vague. Iterations will be rapid. You will need to be nimble and take smart risks.

postings.text: Partner Software Engineer Intern, Ecosystem Engineering
postings.description:
Who are we?
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 200+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. We are reinventing entertainment from end to end. We are revolutionizing how shows and movies are produced, pushing technological boundaries to efficiently deliver streaming video at massive scale over the internet, and continuously improving and personalizing how content is presented around the globe.

The Partner Engineering team delivers Netflix on hundreds of millions of partner devices from smart TV’s to MVPD Set Top Boxes to streaming sticks. The team collaborates with partners across the globe to deliver the Netflix Streaming Client on their devices, which is a core part of the Netflix experience.

We want to delight our customers with a service that just works, always. We are looking for a talented software engineer to explore and lay the groundwork for us to deliver a world-class highly reliable Netflix application. Our partner devices run a diverse set of operating systems including other 3rd party technologies with multiple stakeholder companies spread around the world, making the scaling of the Netflix application a unique challenge. We continue to drive forward the state of the art for streaming device product experiences, globally, through the use of our partnerships.

Who are you?
• Experience with Operating Systems (Linux/Android/POSIX), Native Languages (C/C++), Scripting (Javascript/Python).
• Experience with data structures, algorithms, embedded software development, and source control systems like GIT or similar.
• Passionate about device automation interfacing to backend systems.
• Planning for future coursework in Distributed Systems, Computer Architecture, Networking, Streaming etc.
• Current MS or PhD pursuing Computer Science, Computer/Software Engineering, graduating in fall/winter 2022 or after.

What will you learn?
• Different device platforms, middlewares, and media pipelines.
• Impact of tooling to build best quality products for scale.
• Impact of global partnerships to business growth and customer joy.
• Collaboration and Communication skills working with multiple stakeholders.
• Products at the nexus of Embedded Technology and Entertainment. 

The Summer Internship
At Netflix, we offer a personalized experience for interns, and our aim is to offer an experience that mimics what it is like to actually work here. We match qualified interns with projects and groups based on interests and skill sets, and fully embed interns within those groups for the summer. Netflix is a unique place to work and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture.

Internships are paid and are a minimum of 12 weeks, with a choice of a few fixed start dates in May or June to accommodate varying school calendars. Conditions permitting, our summer internships in 2022 will be located — depending on the team — either remotely, in our Los Gatos, CA, or in our Los Angeles, CA, office.

Netflix is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

postings.text: Sr. Software Engineer - Computer Vision Infrastructure
postings.description:
Are you passionate about building a greenfield Computer Vision infrastructure that powers Netflix Studio Algorithms to revolutionize content production? At Netflix, we strive to entertain and to bring joy to people across the world through amazing stories. We are creating original content at an unprecedented scale and have become the largest studio in the world. 

With a catalog spanning thousands of original titles and a diverse member base spanning 200+ million members, building Studio algorithms to assist artists in asset generation (artwork, trailers etc.) and content production in an efficient fashion is crucial. In this role, you will have the opportunity to build our CV infrastructure that will be used to power our Studio algorithms. 

These algorithms enable the tools used by artists in virtual production, visual effects (VFX), post production, and animation, and help them focus more on the creative aspects to achieve the highest quality content output they desire. You will be working closely with ML researchers, product managers and engineers in the Studio and Personalization domain to help them scale their offline experimentation and productization efforts.

Here are some examples of the types of things you would work on:

  • Unlock new areas of innovation in Studio algos by enabling easy access to assets such as artwork, video, audio, subtitles, scripts etc. in an efficient and secure manner.
  • Build a greenfield CV infrastructure that can be leveraged for feature extraction and sharing across pipelines, model training & fine-tuning, metrics computation and model deployment.
  • Optimize training infrastructure using multi-node GPUs to accelerate innovation on compute intensive CV models.
  • Work closely with ML researchers & Studio teams to productize Deep Learning models that can scale to all videos in our catalog.

To learn more, take a look at some of our blog posts and talks:

  • Netflix ML Platform 
  • Computer Vision Research

Minimum Requirements

  • 4+ years of building large scale ML Infrastructure
  • Strong experience with Python and/or C++
  • Experience handling Media data for efficiently assembling ML training datasets
  • Experience using Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras or PyTorch
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills

Even better if you have any of the following

  • Familiarity with Computer Graphics, VFX or Animation
  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms like Amazon AWS
Our Culture
You can learn more about Netflix’s culture of Freedom and Responsibility, which presents an opportunity to work with some of the best and the brightest, allowing you to make a difference to our business in a meaningful way.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to build our CV infrastructure that will be used to power our Studio algorithms.  These algorithms enable the tools used by artists in virtual production, visual effects (VFX), post production, and animation, and help them focus more on the creative aspects to achieve the highest quality content output they desire. You will be working closely with ML researchers, product managers and engineers in the Studio and Personalization domain to help them scale their offline experimentation and productization efforts. Here are some examples of the types of things you would work on:
  • Unlock new areas of innovation in Studio algos by enabling easy access to assets such as artwork, video, audio, subtitles, scripts etc. in an efficient and secure manner.
  • Build a greenfield CV infrastructure that can be leveraged for feature extraction and sharing across pipelines, model training & fine-tuning, metrics computation and model deployment.
  • Optimize training infrastructure using multi-node GPUs to accelerate innovation on compute intensive CV models.
  • Work closely with ML researchers & Studio teams to productize Deep Learning models that can scale to all videos in our catalog.
    • To learn more, take a look at some of our blog posts and talks:
  • Netflix ML Platform 
  • Computer Vision Research
    • Minimum Requirements
  • 4+ years of building large scale ML Infrastructure
  • Strong experience with Python and/or C++
  • Experience handling Media data for efficiently assembling ML training datasets
  • Experience using Deep Learning frameworks such as TensorFlow, Keras or PyTorch
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
    • Even better if you have any of the following
  • Familiarity with Computer Graphics, VFX or Animation
  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms like Amazon AWS
    • Our Culture You can learn more about Netflix’s culture of Freedom and Responsibility, which presents an opportunity to work with some of the best and the brightest, allowing you to make a difference to our business in a meaningful way.

postings.text: Manager, Infrastructure, Data Science and Engineering
postings.description:
Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment and shaping the evolution of storytelling around the world.  We deliver billions of hours of movies and shows per month to more than 200+ million accounts globally, reaching new audiences every day.  Netflix’s cloud infrastructure plays a pivotal role in making the product experience great for its global subscriber base.  We are a data-inspired company and we leverage data to make our product and the underlying infrastructure better.  
The Infrastructure focused Data Science & Engineering team enables software engineers to architect, scale and operate cloud infrastructure in a secure, efficient and reliable way and to secure subscribers and devices.  It also enables Neflix’s productive workforce to soar.  We conduct analyses and develop analytic tools, build predictive models and algorithms using machine learning, all with the goal of future proofing Netflix as a business.  Check out this blog post to learn more about the area and some of the problems we're working on, and for more about our broader research and analytics work, you can visit the Netflix Research website.
You will lead a team within the Infrastructure Data Science and Engineering organization, a cross functional team of talented individual contributors with a diverse set of skills across analytics, data engineering, machine learning, modeling and experimentation to help scale data-powered innovation at Netflix.  You'll identify and build data products with an eye toward scaling analytics and access to insights to help improve Netflix's ability to stream to the world.
Infrastructure teams:

Core Data Science and Engineering - Responsible for making the Data Science and Engineering organization as productive as possible.  Partners closely with the Data Platform and other data and engineering teams to build productivity tooling, maintain highly reusable data sources, and promote innovation for data engineers, data analysts, data scientists, and other data professionals.

Platform Scale - Responsible for improving Netflix’s ability to scale the infrastructure to its global audience and evolving business needs.  Partners closely with Platform Engineering, InfoSec, Strategy and Finance, Demand Planning, and other engineering teams to add data insights to human and machine decision makers.  

Security (Now Hiring) - Responsible for securing Netflix’s information and application space.  Partners closely with InfoSec, AppSec, Legal, Data Platform, Networking, and other engineering teams to build scalable data solutions that improve Netflix’s trustworthiness and ability to meet regulatory requirements globally.  

Platform Innovation - Responsible for building leverage in the infrastructure that increased the productivity and innovation capabilities of our internal workforce.  Partners closely with Data Platform, Productivity tooling, and other engineering teams to create core datasets that expose patterns about the utilization and overall goodness of our tech stack, to enable automation, determine defaults, and allow for large scale migrations.

What will fill your days

  • Visionary: You intuitively understand business and technology and you leverage that to guide a team providing relevant context and inspiration.
  • Partnership: You establish strong relationships with both business and technical leaders across Netflix.
  • Technical Leadership: You lead from the front and are curious about the domain and able to find opportunities for impact to the business.
  • Recruiting: You are constantly on the lookout for talent and have a knack for recognizing and attracting top-tier engineers to your team. You understand the importance of building an amazing team and the value it brings to the overall company.
  • Feedback & Development:  You see people’s strengths/weaknesses and are both gifted and courageous in talking with them about it.

Character & qualities that will help you succeed

  • You’re willing to risk rejection. When you fail, you learn and are willing to try again.
  • You’re not afraid of hard conversations and sharing your perspective.
  • You embrace diversity in the workplace and you strive to seek diverse ideas and opinions.
  • You’re a creative revolutionary, forward thinking and proactive.
  • You possess a solid sense of business acumen.
  • You listen and communicate well.
  • You’re allergic to micromanagement. 
  • You prefer to give context, delegate, and watch amazing people exceed your hopes and expectations.
  • You’re a natural leader but your team and colleagues see your humility.

Who you are

  • You likely have a M.S. or Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Statistics, Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, Physics, Operations Research, etc. Technical publications and ties to academic communities are a plus.
  • You have hired and led cross functional data-focused teams comprised of engineers, analysts and scientists with diverse technical strengths.
  • You have experience building a technical vision.
  • You are an advocate for engineering excellence.
  • You have used big data technologies (i.e. Spark/MapReduce/Hadoop, etc…) at one point in your career and built large scale data pipelines.
  • You have a background in two or more of the following disciplines: software engineering, data analytics, statistics, modeling, machine learning, and experimentation. 
  • You have used SQL, Python and some reporting/visualization tools at one point in your career.
Culture
At Netflix, we build dream teams to solve real world complex business problems and set high expectations from each team member.   Everyone at Netflix cherishes the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence in a fast paced, exciting environment.  Our culture is unique and we strive to live by our values, so it's worth learning more about Netflix culture at jobs.netflix.com.

postings.text: Product Manager, Animation Studio Technology
postings.description:
We want to entertain the world. If we succeed, there is more laughter, more empathy, and more joy.

So far, we’ve grown to over 209 million paid memberships and have been creating new original content at a pace that’s turned us quickly into the largest entertainment studio in the world. That said, we’ve only just begun our journey at Netflix to become the Animation studio we aim to be!
 
With all this studio growth, we on the Animation Studio Technology team are on a mission to create a studio that can run at an unprecedented scale and where creative visionaries can do their best work without compromise. 
 
This role is specifically on the Studio Operations team, where we have a small, passionate, and curious product team that aims to support an unparalleled level of decision-making and efficiency at the animation studio so that we can spend as much time as possible bringing phenomenal stories to the screen in the best way possible.

Responsibilities

  • Set a vision and strategy for production management workflows in the Animation space across both the studio and shows
  • Problem-solve with Design and Engineering partners to create elegant and pragmatic solutions
  • Lead a large cross-functional team to define a roadmap and execute ideas
  • Partner with the Studio partners across Studio Leadership, Production Management, Consumer Insights, Data Science, and more groups on how the status quo of the Animation industry can be challenged through technology
  • Foster and thrive in healthy debate while also communicating your vision and strategy broadly throughout the organization

What We’re Looking For

  • 4+ years of hands-on product management experience in delivering software products
  • Humility and voracious curiosity to learn complex systems quickly
  • A deep love for problem-solving paired with a grittiness to drive projects to completion
  • Ability to prioritize well, and articulate your product roadmap across business functions
  • Ability to inspire, motivate, and lead designers, engineers, and data scientists 
  • Flexibility for relatively frequent travel between Northern and Southern California
  • Exceptional analytical and creative skills

postings.text: Senior Security Partner, Product Security
postings.description:
At Netflix we do one thing - entertainment - and we aim to do it really well. To accomplish this goal, we must produce, distribute, and stream content at a massive scale. We have a strong engineering organization that enables us to achieve these business objectives and a unique and creative culture that guides us to operate with “Freedom and Responsibility”. This helps keep engineering velocity high, but also means that our security team needs to operate differently than a traditional security team. Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility to do the right thing for Netflix. Instead of controlling engineers with process and security gates, we enable them to build secure code and provide them with adequate security context to make the right decisions for Netflix.

The Application Security (Appsec) organization at Netflix helps secure internally built systems and applications that run the Netflix business and the streaming product. We aren’t your typical Appsec team because we focus our efforts on scalable investments in both our engineering and partnership services. The Appsec Partnerships team is the part of this organization that builds close partnerships with key areas in our engineering ecosystem to identify and drive high-impact security initiatives (e.g.: Secure by Default in Developer Productivity tools, Secure Application Gateway for all workforce apps). We are looking for security engineers to join the team to help identify and drive high-leverage security improvements and improve the security of the Netflix engineering ecosystem. You will also leverage your security skills to support the Netflix bug bounty program, participate in our product security incident response efforts and other operational Appsec responsibilities.  We are hiring for security partner roles in two domains:

End-User Products - This role is to support product and engineering teams that build end user-facing products for streaming and studio use cases.  Specific background includes application security knowledge and scalable approaches to end-user product security. 

Platform Products - This role is to support product and engineering teams that build developer-facing platform and infrastructure tools (e.g.: Compute and Networking Platforms, Service Proxies etc). Specific background includes infrastructure security knowledge and an understanding of systemic security challenges for platform and infrastructure-as-a-service offerings. 

Desired background:

  • You have experience with threat modeling, security design reviews, and security architecture. 
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and are able to translate security objectives to engineering team asks. 
  • You have experience partnering with cross-functional teams to deliver widely impactful security initiatives. 
  • You demonstrate excellent judgement in prioritizing security efforts to mitigate the appropriate risks.  

Finally, here’s a few more reasons why we love this work and think that you will too:

  • You will have the opportunity to facilitate impactful security work for the Netflix engineering ecosystem.
  • You will work with an industry-leading security team with many opportunities to reduce risks in existing projects and identify new ones.
  • You will have the opportunity to research new ideas and share your ideas across the community.
  • You will work closely with domain experts in diverse areas such as microservices architecture, big data, compute platforms, and content delivery networks.
We are looking for thoughtful security professionals who enable our mission and support our culture of freedom and responsibility.  You can learn more about life at Netflix by watching our security talks or exploring our open source work.

postings.text: Product Reliability Engineer, Technical Project Management
postings.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

As a Product Reliability Engineer within the Technology Services organization, you will act as a Technical Project Manager who focuses on understanding how people use and interact with technology to help product and operational teams increase their impact and efficiency. You will work horizontally across the different verticals of the business (product, support, data science teams, etc.), and you will proactively seek out projects and initiatives to enact change and reduce complexity. You will be leveraging your technical knowledge and skills to advocate for improvements across the hardware/software product ecosystems and groups that we support. Practically speaking, this requires in-deep data-driven analysis of different varieties of problems, designing and documenting workflows, and testing techniques for the purpose of creating efficiencies and scalable solutions that drive impact and improvements. 

This role will require great communicators, storytellers, and advocates who can consult with a wide breadth of groups. You will partner closely with different teams and leaders to understand the problem space and domain in-depth, analyze, help create a strategy, prioritize based on impact, write memos, and help to drive them through to completion. 

Finally, you will play an essential role in the strategic growth of the Technology Services organization. You will help manage the roadmap, influence the operational quality of the teams, and proactively identify and standardize methods for engaging high-quality research.

Core Responsibilities:

  • Manage complex and large-scale cross-team, cross-functional initiatives.
  • Drive projects related to growth, reliability, efficiency, security, performance, and overall health of tools/services/products/platforms/teams supported by Netflix Technology Operations.
  • Apply systems analysis techniques to internal services at Netflix: including writing complex SQL statements and joins and creating visualizations to tell clear stories about complexities.
  • Develop strong cross-functional relationships with business partners across Studio, Corporate, Security, Creative Production, Data Engineering, Analytical, Support teams, and others. 
  • Measure and track project performance using data, appropriate systems, tools, and techniques.
  • Facilitate and consult on roadmap prioritization of Netflix Technology organization. 
  • Be a bridge between support teams, partners, and stakeholders.
  • Advocate for users and stakeholders by exposing friction and reliability concerns within the products that also drive pain for support teams.
  • Learn new tools, systems, and technologies quickly as required by the particular project you work on.

Qualifications and Expectations:

  • Five or more years of Technical Project Management experience or relevant experience managing technical efforts. 
  • Five or more years of experience in insights gathering or analytics with hands-on expertise and a passion for research; certification/QA insights experience is a plus.
  • Demonstrate the ability to gather and analyze various data points (qualitative and quantitative) and whittle that information down to the most salient insights for the business. 
  • Big data experience with extracting (e.g., SQL, Apache Spark, Python) and visualizing data (e.g., Tableau)
  • Proven effectiveness at delivering impactful presentations/memos to a variety of audiences.
  • Proven experience building productive relationships with partners and leaders across the organization.
  • Ability to effectively debate and use data as the basis of your argument.
  • Ability to manage multiple competing priorities simultaneously without losing sight of key goals. Ability to drive teams/decisions through ambiguity.
  • Ability to influence and motivate people across a wide variety of job functions through your relationships.
  • Passionate, Proactive, Curious.  
  • Plus: Technical knowledge and understanding of security controls and solutions across security domains such as enterprise security, access management, including authentication and authorization, user/identity management, protocols and concepts (e.g., Single Sign-On), encryptions, vulnerability management, and network security.
  • Plus: Technical knowledge and understanding of Corporate Enterprise technologies and solutions.

postings.text: Senior Software Engineer - TVUI Foundation
postings.description:
The Team

The TVUI Foundation team builds JavaScript UI frameworks which power the Netflix TV UI application on devices ranging from streaming sticks and cable boxes to Smart TVs and game consoles.

We’re passionate about creating elegantly designed, highly performant UI architectures which empower engineers to build amazing TV UI experiences used by millions of users across the globe. We partner closely with teams across Netflix to help us deliver solutions which make UI development efficient and enjoyable.

Diverse and inclusive teams are strong teams. We encourage those with varied identities, backgrounds, and experiences to apply. We believe that creating a sense of belonging allows us to be our best selves, which in turn helps us produce our best work. We rely on our unique individual strengths to help each other grow.

We have a distributed team, with some teammates working remotely, and some colocated in the Los Gatos, CA office. The team is committed to being ‘remote-inclusive’ and believe it’s about the work you do, and the relationships you build. Where you can best do that from is up to you.

The Role

This role provides an opportunity to explore the unique UI framework challenges presented by the TV UI application stack - balancing the performance constraints of the devices we support with developer-friendly solutions which scale.

We’re currently building solutions with JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and Redux. We provide ergonomic solutions for UI engineers to handle application state, access data, configure their applications, handle route navigation, define complex animations and create consistent, flexible, and testable UI components. We work on client side and server side solutions - wherever a problem takes us. And that’s just scratching the surface.

Many of the projects we take on are broad cross-functional efforts, allowing you to extend beyond our team and engage with teams across the company. We’re a team of peers without hierarchies based on title or tenure. Everyone has the opportunity to scope, architect, implement, and support the solutions we deliver.

Some of our past work:
- Crafting a High Performance TV User Interface Using React
- Performance without Compromise
- Pass The Remote: User Input on TV Devices

And some of the things we’re excited about working on next:
- Migrating our code base to TypeScript
- Rearchitecting how we handle async app state management and data access in the UI
- Building the frameworks to optimize feature-flag based development

You

People who do well on the team are self-motivated engineers with a passion for driving technology innovation rooted in business and customer needs. Great analytical and technical skills form a solid foundation. But more importantly, we look for engineers who understand that there are rarely any absolutes when it comes to technology. The ability to effectively discuss use cases, prioritization and technical challenges with colleagues and weigh trade-offs across multiple solutions is a skill we value highly.

All of this, so that Netflix members can immerse themselves in the stories they care about, on the devices they love, from whichever part of the world they call home. Without the technology behind it all ever getting in the way.

If this resonates with you, we’d love to talk!

What’s Different About Us

  • Scale, Impact
  • Hundred Engineers : You’ll be improving UI development velocity for 100 engineers...
  • Millions of Users : creating best-in-class streaming UIs used by over 100M users...
  • Hundreds of Devices : across a wide spectrum of devices...
  • Globally : in almost every country in the world.
  • Unique Technical Challenges : We build framework solutions which are flexible enough to withstand the span of use cases introduced by rapid A/B test development, across a varied client, server and network performance landscape, all while being ergonomic to use for the engineers we support.
  • Collaboration and Communication : It’s not all about the tech. We highly value the skills required to build strong relationships and collaborate effectively.
  • Freedom, Responsibility, Ownership : We believe in providing engineers with the business context they need, and then giving them the freedom and responsibility to define project scope, define/debate architecture, determine trade-offs, and figure out the implementation details.
  • Our Culture : Lastly, but most importantly, we live by our values.

What Sets You Apart

  • You’re passionate about writing elegantly designed, maintainable, performant software
  • You enjoy pushing the boundaries of what technology can do, and exploring uncharted waters
  • You love the idea of your work empowering other engineers and strive to understand their use cases
  • Colleagues appreciate the unique perspectives and balanced views you bring to collaborations
  • You value the opinion of others when fleshing out solutions, to fill out your blind spots
  • You know that there is rarely a single ‘right’ solution, and are thoughtful about trade-offs
  • You understand that it is really about solving problems. A language, framework or library choice is just a means to an end.

postings.text: Senior Software Engineer, Partner & Payment Experiences
postings.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. As a global household brand, we strive to bring joy to users by connecting them with stories and artists through a delightful and high-quality experience. We are looking for stellar software engineers to join our team and help us on our journey to entertain hundreds of millions of customers worldwide.

About the team
Partner & Payment Experiences (PPX) team plays a vital role in Netflix’s subscriber and revenue growth by building systems and functionalities that enable subscribers in different parts of the world to pay for the service using a wide variety of payment methods. Driven by the vision of making payments a seamless part of the Netflix experience, this team is focused on enhancing, through relentless experimentation, the underlying services that drive the customer acquisition experience across our Website, Connected TVs, and Mobile Devices. In addition to driving the payment experience in the organic signup channel, services owned by this team also power different partner-acquisition journeys such as Bundles, Partner Payments, Gift Cards, etc.  

We are looking for product-focused, growth-minded, and thoughtful software engineers who desire to impact tens of millions of users worldwide. As an engineer on this team, you’ll be responsible for designing and developing product features, A/B experiences, and underlying APIs and services essential to expanding Netflix’s global reach. 

About You

  • You have 7+ years of rich experience in high-quality software development.
  • You enjoy working in a highly cross-functional environment involving different engineering and business stakeholders.
  • You are ambitious and highly motivated to deliver outstanding solutions with minimal guidance.
  • You proactively address inefficiencies in your environment - product, codebase, team, and company.
  • You write code to provide business value, not merely to churn out features.
  • You are curious about new technologies and can quickly evaluate and adapt as needed.
  • Your co-workers think of you as someone who is kind and does excellent work

Nice to Haves

  • You have experience in the Payments domain.
  • You have experience running A/B tests to optimize the growth of a product.
  • You have experience with highly distributed tiered service architectures (a.k.a. "microservices").
  • You are passionate about application scalability, availability, reliability, and security.
  • You are proficient with RESTful API design and implementation.
Netflix is an equal opportunity employer and strives to build diverse teams from all walks of life. We offer a unique culture of freedom and responsibility with a clear long-term view. We recommend reading through these to understand what working at Netflix and on this team is like.

postings.text: Senior Software Engineer, Personalization Application Core
postings.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 200 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across various genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. At Netflix, we use personalization to recommend great titles to our users. 

The Personalization Application Core team focuses on building high leverage systems and components to drive innovation in the personalization space. Our team is responsible for developing all the building blocks required to run ML models at scale. Some of those building blocks include a configuration-driven ranking platform that provides “ranking as a service”, a common feature computation and store, a common compute framework with an event pub/sub ecosystem that can be leveraged by all our personalization algorithms, and many more. 

Given that this is a central focus for our business, you will play a highly cross-functional role partnering with other engineers, product management, machine learning, and data teams to take Netflix's personalization to the next level. We are looking for a strong backend engineer who has an excellent track record in building large scale distributed systems.  

If you have a passion for building scalable, robust systems; are interested in pushing the envelope in applying discovery and recommendation algorithms; operate in a critical part of the stack that strongly influences what our customers see on their screens; love working with the latest technologies in a fast-paced, agile environment; and are excited at the prospect of having a significant impact on software that over 193 million people use and love, then we want to talk to you.

Who you are

  • You are curious about discovering new and better ways to solve problems.
  • You aim for broad, optimal solutions while solving the practical task at hand.
  • You seek to make your team and the product you work on better as you go.
  • You are willing to take broad ownership of team responsibilities.
  • You are excited to work in a multidisciplinary environment (engineering, algorithms, data engineering/science, product experimentation).

Requirements

  • 8+ years of software engineering experience with a proven track record of delivering quality results
  • Strong software architecture & design skills
  • Strong coding skills, preferably in Java
  • Experience with large-scale distributed systems
  • Experience with public cloud like AWS, Azure or GCP
  • Experience working with ML or ML teams
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • BS/MS in computer science (or equivalent)

Nice to have

  • Experience with content discovery, personalization, recommendations
  • Experience with A/B testing
  • Experience with big data

postings.text: Senior Software Engineer - Revenue Finance Infrastructure
postings.description:
Netflix is the world’s leading entertainment service with over 193+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries.
Revenue Infrastructure is our growing Squad within Revenue & Growth Engineering. This Squad is tasked with the long-term goal of building solutions to automate Revenue Finance workflows, handling millions of transactions flowing through our services every day. Some of the immediate projects we are focused on are building infrastructure for settlement and cash reconciliation of all Netflix subscription payments, generating invoices for our bundle partners, and revenue partner workflows. We have many more ambitions to innovate for Streaming and Partner revenue finance needs.

As an engineer on the team, you will work with Product Managers, cross-functional engineering teams, and Revenue Finance to design and evolve architectures that can handle massive data and build highly configurable pipelines to support global workflows for complex financial functions.

About You

  • 5+ years of hands-on, software engineering experience in building business-critical, reliable, and distributed systems.
  • Background in building financial or payments solutions. Experience in leveraging ML is a plus.
  • You are driven by the desire to solve hard technical problems with the goal to automate and scale everything!
  • You are self-motivated and love making an impact.
  • You can work independently, delivering innovative solutions with minimal guidance.
  • You have a successful track record of delivering results in complex cross-functional projects.
  • You strongly believe in test-driven development.
  • You have a strong bias towards action.

Technical Expectations

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or equivalent.
  • Strong data structures and algorithms knowledge with server side expertise.
  • Have a strong background in distributed data processing, software engineering design, and data modeling concepts.
  • Proficient in Java, Scala, or any other JVM language.
  • Experience with Pub-Sub( Kafka) , Stream Processing(Spark/Flink etc.)
  • Expertise with solving large data challenges.
  • Experience with Cloud Computing platforms (AWS/Azure/GCP).
  • Expertise in building distributed applications that are secure, can scale and are highly available.
Netflix offers an exciting employee culture that enables freedom and responsibility.  Learn more about us via the Netflix culture memo and jobs site.

Learn what have we done in the past?
Building Resilience in Production Migrations
Building financial Systems on Eventually consistent DBs
Billing Tech blog on Cloud migration
Netflix Tech blog

postings.text: Senior Software Engineer (USD Pipeline) - Animation Studio Technology
postings.description:
It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. We’ve become one of the largest entertainment studios in the world, creating new original content at an incredible pace.  The Studio Innovation product team is front and center of this growth. We build software that fuels the production and creation of Netflix content. The Animation Studio Technology team within Studio Innovation builds products that power the Netflix Animation Studio ecosystem. Netflix is on a path to release six animated feature films per year, which no major studio has ever done, on top of the very healthy slate of animation series.

About the Role:
The Software Engineer (USD Pipeline) is responsible for developing and deploying USD as a foundational technology for the Netflix animation pipeline.   They will partner with production stakeholders and other technology teams to both support and augment the studio's existing USD tools and workflows, as well as help develop new ones.

Responsibilities:

  • Integrate USD into the Netflix animation pipeline for asset development and shot production.
  • Drive continued development of the Netflix USD shot and asset model to support evolving production requirements.
  • Collaborate with production and technology stakeholders to deploy and integrate new USD features, asset model changes, and pipeline tools.
  • Monitor Open Source USD development and coordinate production adoption of new USD versions and schemas.
  • Plan and implement USD version upgrades, including USD plugins and third party tools.
  • Work with software deployment teams to troubleshoot USD and USD plugin runtime environments and build issues.
  • Provide training to TD and Software Engineers on USD and related APIs.
  • Work with software deployment teams to manage internal USD repositories for plugins, extensions, and pipeline code.
  • Maintain an active presence in the USD community and coordinate Netflix contributions to the USD project.

Qualifications:

  • Experience and expertise in USD and its deployment in a production environment
  • Previous development experience in a Python/C++/Linux production environment
  • Strong verbal and written communication skills
  • Self-motivated and detailed approach to problem solving
For more information on what it’s like to work at Netflix, please take a look at our culture memo!

postings.text: Senior Full Stack Developer, Data Science and Insights
postings.description:
Netflix is a pioneer in the entertainment industry, merging the creativity of Hollywood with the technical innovation of Silicon Valley.  Netflix currently serves over 140 million subscribers in more than 190 countries around the world and spent over $12 billion on television, films, documentaries and other entertainment content in 2018 alone.

As Netflix continues to grow - we are leveraging the unique position we have as both a content distributor and producer to create cutting-edge data driven insights supporting a variety of decisions about the content we make and buy.

We’re looking for a senior software engineer to build new tools to help us become the first truly data-driven content studio in the world.  You’ll work closely with data scientists to create interactive web applications that will not only surface critical insights to business and creative stakeholders, but collect critical information from key decision makers allowing us to continually learn and innovate around the ways we discover and evaluate new content.

In this role, you will:

  • Partner closely with data scientists to create new tools and workflows that will maximize the impact of our data teams.
  • Work with stakeholders to rapidly iterate on your initial designs based on user research and feedback.
  • Work with larger engineering teams to integrate your new innovations into existing workflows and tools as they mature.

About you:

  • Experienced building full-stack web apps. You have deep experience with Node.js and front-end JavaScript. You have experience working with a component framework like React or Vue.js. D3 or other visualization experience preferred.
  • Someone who loves building V1 - exploring a new concept from start to finish and building it from the ground up. You welcome user feedback, and use that information to iterate on the tool.
  • Passionate about telling stories with data and have a knack for visualizing complex and large-scale data outputs in intuitive ways.
  • Experienced in designing, building, and iterating on interfaces, with a strong sense of the entire user experience, not just the individual pieces.  
  • Experience with big data technologies (SparkSQL, Map/Reduce, ETL scheduling, etc.)) is a plus. Bonus points for familiarity with Elasticsearch queries.
  • Interested in building tools that can help to collect data as well as visualize it - experience with crowdsourcing tools or casual games a plus
  • Motivated to explore new technologies, and comfortable with self-directed learning.
postings.search_text:
Los Angeles, California Product Data Science and Engineering Senior Full Stack Developer, Data Science and Insights Netflix is a pioneer in the entertainment industry, merging the creativity of Hollywood with the technical innovation of Silicon Valley.  Netflix currently serves over 140 million subscribers in more than 190 countries around the world and spent over $12 billion on television, films, documentaries and other entertainment content in 2018 alone. As Netflix continues to grow - we are leveraging the unique position we have as both a content distributor and producer to create cutting-edge data driven insights supporting a variety of decisions about the content we make and buy. We’re looking for a senior software engineer to build new tools to help us become the first truly data-driven content studio in the world.  You’ll work closely with data scientists to create interactive web applications that will not only surface critical insights to business and creative stakeholders, but collect critical information from key decision makers allowing us to continually learn and innovate around the ways we discover and evaluate new content. In this role, you will:
  • Partner closely with data scientists to create new tools and workflows that will maximize the impact of our data teams.
  • Work with stakeholders to rapidly iterate on your initial designs based on user research and feedback.
  • Work with larger engineering teams to integrate your new innovations into existing workflows and tools as they mature.
    • About you:
  • Experienced building full-stack web apps. You have deep experience with Node.js and front-end JavaScript. You have experience working with a component framework like React or Vue.js. D3 or other visualization experience preferred.
  • Someone who loves building V1 - exploring a new concept from start to finish and building it from the ground up. You welcome user feedback, and use that information to iterate on the tool.
  • Passionate about telling stories with data and have a knack for visualizing complex and large-scale data outputs in intuitive ways.
  • Experienced in designing, building, and iterating on interfaces, with a strong sense of the entire user experience, not just the individual pieces.  
  • Experience with big data technologies (SparkSQL, Map/Reduce, ETL scheduling, etc.)) is a plus. Bonus points for familiarity with Elasticsearch queries.
  • Interested in building tools that can help to collect data as well as visualize it - experience with crowdsourcing tools or casual games a plus
  • Motivated to explore new technologies, and comfortable with self-directed learning.

postings.text: Senior Privacy Engineer
postings.description:
Netflix is revolutionizing entertainment by producing, distributing, and streaming content at a massive scale. Over 200 million members around the globe are currently enjoying more than two billion hours per month of original series, documentaries and feature films.  Visit our long-term view to learn more.
 
The Team
The Privacy Assurance & Engineering team promotes privacy-enhancing designs, sets engineering standards and builds systems to ensure Netflix is managing data correctly. We are a small and agile team with tremendous visibility and impact, and with Netflix’s culture of  “Freedom and Responsibility”, you’ll decide how to best use your talents and time.

The Role
We are looking for a Senior Privacy Engineer to join us as a technical lead for exciting privacy engineering topics across Netflix! In this role you will provide engineering and product teams guidance by analyzing systems, defining technical requirements, and designing privacy and data management solutions. You will also bridge the gap between engineering and legal by leveraging both your technical and privacy domain expertise. In this role, you will primarily support new feature and business development for Netflix, while working alongside an industry leading security and privacy team with many opportunities to improve existing initiatives and identify new ones.

Desired background:

  • You are passionate about privacy and have experience in cryptography and privacy enhancing technologies.
  • You have a security mindset, possibly from conducting application security reviews or privacy red teaming.
  • You have extensive software engineering and design experience, optimally spanning over both microservices architectures and big data environments.
  • You operate effectively across teams and disciplines in highly ambiguous and rapidly changing environments.
  • You enjoy both hands-on technical challenges as well as strategic leadership and influencing change at scale.
Stunning colleagues come from different education levels and backgrounds. The Netflix culture determines who we hire, how we work together and how we make decisions. You will be surrounded by a great team and empowered to produce your best work.

postings.text: Software Engineer Intern, Content Engineering
postings.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 203+ million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Netflix is reinventing entertainment from end to end. We are revolutionizing how shows and movies are produced, pushing technological boundaries to efficiently deliver streaming video at massive scale over the internet, and continuously improving and personalizing how content is presented around the globe. 

Content Engineering builds the products and services used by our creative teams producing and managing our global content. Our products enable the entire workflow of content production, from script to screen, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. 

You’ll have a direct impact on how the Netflix studio creates and produces shows like “The Witcher", "The Crown", "The Queen’s Gambit”, and many more on a global scale. With an increasing slate of original content being produced every year, our products manage billions of dollars worth of content-spend. 

We are looking for backend software engineer interns to help our teams build large-scale backend applications that power the entire Netflix experience, on and off service. Within a week of submitting an application here to this internship role, you'll receive an Airtable form in your inbox to fill out to complete your application.

Who are you?

  • Currently a rising Junior or rising Senior, pursuing a Bachelor’s degree (or higher) in Computer Science or a related field, and you should still be enrolled after the internship ends
  • Curious and motivated learner 
  • Clear communicator - you are concise and articulate in speech and writing
  • Coursework or some experience with data structures and algorithms and bonus if you’ve taken a course on distributed systems.
  • Practical knowledge of Java or any other object-oriented programming language. 
  • Familiarity in utilizing modern version control systems such as Git.

What will you learn?

  • Build large-scale applications that solve complex business problems elegantly.
  • Distributed system design and architecture process
  • Writing high quality, performant, and industry-standard code
  • Some of the best technologies used in building cloud software - gRPC, ProtoBufs, GraphQL, Spring Boot, and many more
  • Working closely with other engineers, and cross-functional partners in a fast-paced environment
The Summer Internship
At Netflix, we offer a personalized experience for interns, and our aim is to offer an experience that mimics what it is like to actually work here. We match qualified interns with projects and groups based on interests and skill sets, and fully embed interns within those groups for the summer. Netflix is a unique place to work and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture.

Internships are paid and are a minimum of 12 weeks, with a choice of a few fixed start dates in May or June to accommodate varying school calendars. Conditions permitting, our 2022 summer internships will be located either remotely, in our Los Gatos, CA office, or in our Los Angeles, CA office, depending on the team.

Netflix is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

postings.text: Senior Full Stack Product Engineer - Growth Notifications
postings.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with more than 200  million members in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

The Team
The Messaging Engineering team at Netflix creates & delivers multi-channel messaging experiences for customers and partners in the Netflix ecosystems. The team owns the platform, applications, channels, and messages that enable Netflix to communicate with its customers and partners.

We are an experimentation-focused product development team. We experiment on outbound messaging channels such as Email, Push, Messaging Apps, and the browser to name a few. The team also owns in-product notifications on all Netflix supported devices. We experiment on messaging experiences in the Notification Center and elsewhere within the product.

You can read more details on some of the work the team has done on the Messaging @ Netflix site.

The Role
As a Senior Full Stack Product Engineer on the Growth Notifications Team, you will be responsible for innovation on the Netflix product through notifications to help Netflix on its path to 500 million members. You will ideate and implement experiments (A/B Tests), build features, deploy systems, and work in a cross functional team of stunning colleagues that includes teammates from product management, design, data science, consumer insights, and engineering. On the backend you will enable product experiences by working closely with UI engineers on Android, iOS, Website, and TV. On the frontend side, you will develop product experiences using email as the canvas as well as collaborate with a core set of email UI developers to build a framework to enable email product development for all of Netflix consumer needs. You will collaborate with engineers on a variety of backend systems from core membership services such as billing, payments, and accounts, to infrastructure, personalization, and content management teams. The team works on projects that bring in millions of dollars of annual incremental revenue for Netflix. 

This is a highly visible role that gives you the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on the growth of Netflix. 

Required Skills

  • Experience in developing consumer-facing applications through experimentation techniques like A/B Testing
  • Fluent in Java and other object oriented languages
  • Prior experience in Typescript
  • Front end web development experience (React, CSS, SASS/LESS)
  • Experience writing SQL queries on big data platforms (SparkSQL, Presto, Hive, etc)
  • Designing intuitive and extensible APIs
  • Developing reusable, templated frameworks

Nice To Have Skills

  • Experience building backend systems to power frontend experiences
  • Experience working with product development teams
  • Prior experience creating web and/or email based experiences with AMP.
  • Experience building flows using various channels like Push, SMS, messaging apps, and In-Product messaging experiences 
  • Experience with localization systems and ICU formatting
  • Prior experience in creating Responsive & Interactive HTML and/or AMP Email Development experience 
  • Previous experience in building large-scale, highly resilient gRPC services

About You

  • You are diligent, thoughtful, and articulate. You have great oral and written communication skills and can communicate with both technical and non-technical audiences
  • You can work across all phases of the software development lifecycle (planning, design, implementation, testing, deployment, operations and support)
  • You can make wise choices and take smart risks when dealing with ambiguous requirements. Once you have context, you can figure out how to solve problems on your own.
  • You are proactive and can move fast or pivot to meet the changing needs of the product
  • You enjoy problem solving and can use everything from big-data to  command line tools to help you identify and fix issues
  • You are passionate about product development and you enjoy the independence of managing projects on your own
  • You care about business strategy and customer experience.
This team is remote inclusive and the Netflix culture is unique. We tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix by reading about our culture. Apply to talk to us to see if this product development role on a small, impactful, and collaborative team is right for you.

postings.text: Original Dialogue / ADR Mixer
postings.description:
About the job

Netflix is building in-house Post Production Facilities and Services in order to support the ever-growing volume of Original Content we are producing. The Studio is focused on delivering the very best levels of service and creative experience to our filmmakers and creative executives. Our Post Production Facilities and Operations team is charged with the Operational Management of these services and spaces, and will be recruiting a team of talented and dedicated individuals to ensure success.

The Role

We are building Animation Studios in Burbank and Hollywood for our Original and Adult Animation production, and we are providing in-house facilities for Dialogue Recording, Dialogue Editing, Music Editing, and talent facing client concierge services. We are looking for an experienced Dialogue Recording Engineer with a comprehensive knowledge of Animation Sound Post Production, to join a team of highly skilled creatives and technicians to collaborate closely with our in house Productions, ensuring an unparalleled creative experience for our filmmakers. The Dialogue Recording Engineer must be proficient in tracking, monitoring and mixing all audio sources during recording sessions, including dialogue, music, and sound effects. This person is expected to work with the production team in maintaining Netflix’s high standards of audio production for all studio shows, and will have proficiency in the use of all studio equipment and technology within assigned operating areas, including but not limited to: audio mixing consoles, outboard equipment, recording software, audio formats and delivery servers, microphone and signal flow, intercom devices, remote recording hardware and software, etc.

Responsibilities

  • Set up and engineer dialogue recording sessions, including production dialogue, scratch dialogue, and ADR
  • Engineer remote dialogue recording sessions via Source Connect and video conferencing platforms
  • Liaise with our Client Services team to provide an unparalleled creative experience for our filmmakers
  • Work closely and partner with Script Supervisors, Editors, Voice Talent, Producers, Writers and Directors
  • Collaborate with other members of the Sound Operations team to design, implement, and maintain in-house recording facilities
  • Ensure project and media files are backed up and archived
  • Notify appropriate Production Staff of any lines lacking clarity or containing potential quality issues
  • Ensure deadlines are consistently met and communicate progress of work to supervisors and to appropriate production staff
  • Collaborate with our sound editors to help maintain the Dialogue, Music and Sound Effects database
  • Help establish and support Sound Department workflow processes and procedures
  • Provide support in the development of proprietary sound production software
  • Ensure that content security protocols are followed at all times

Qualifications

  • 5+ years experience as an in-house recording engineer tracking dialogue for animation (series and features)
  • Expert-level understanding of animation audio production processes and pipelines
  • Advanced knowledge in Avid Pro Tools HD, audio plugins, control surfaces, D/A and A/D converters, clocks, analogue and digital outboard equipment including mic pre-amps, compressors, equalizers, and other standard recording studio hardware, and restoration software (Waves, Izotope RX Advanced, Melodyne, etc)
  • Excellent knowledge of microphones and mic-placement skills
  • Excellent knowledge of Equalization, Compression and Noise Reduction
  • Understanding of immersive mixing formats, including Dolby Atmos
  • Experience in ADR workflows; dialog replacement, group, and animation production
  • Have an ear for quality and strong audio aesthetic sensibilities
  • Knowledge of speaker calibration and room tuning
  • Comprehensive understanding of audio signal flow principles, control surfaces and audio best practices
  • Proficient at multitasking in a highly complex and diverse production environment
  • Highly self-directed; able to manage and (re)prioritize multiple concurrent and competing challenges and issues
  • Comfortable identifying and developing solutions that improve the filmmaker client experience
  • Musical training a plus
  • Knowledgeable in centralized storage systems
  • Experience working in a high-security environment, focusing on content protection
  • Teammate, flexible and collaborative

postings.text: New Grad, Software Engineer
postings.description:
Who are we?
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. 

If you have a passion for solving challenging problems, building scalable, robust systems; love working with the latest technologies in a fast-paced, agile environment; and are excited at the prospect of having a significant impact on software that over 209 million people use and love, then we want to talk to you.

Who are you?

  • New Grad with a BS/BA in a technical field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics (Grad Date between Dec. 2021 & August 2022).
  • 1+ relevant internship experience or school project experience 
  • Great problem-solving skills
  • Curious and motivated learner
  • Clear communicator - you are concise and articulate in speech and writing
  • Coursework or relative experience with data structures, algorithms, and debugging (Bonus if you’ve taken a course on distributed systems).
  • Practical knowledge of Java or any other object-oriented programming language.

What will you learn?

  • Build large-scale applications that solve complex business problems elegantly.
  • Distributed system design and architecture process
  • Writing high quality, performant, and industry-standard code
  • Working closely with business stakeholders in a fast-paced environment

What we use today

  • Java, Gradle, Spring Boot 2.x, gRPC, Atlas, Spinnaker, Elasticsearch, SQL, AWS, etc.
  • Note that you don't need to know all of these right now, but you should be excited to learn them!

Netflix is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.  If you have a passion for solving challenging problems, building scalable, robust systems; love working with the latest technologies in a fast-paced, agile environment; and are excited at the prospect of having a significant impact on software that over 209 million people use and love, then we want to talk to you. Who are you?
  • New Grad with a BS/BA in a technical field such as Computer Science, Engineering, Math, Statistics (Grad Date between Dec. 2021 & August 2022).
  • 1+ relevant internship experience or school project experience 
  • Great problem-solving skills
  • Curious and motivated learner
  • Clear communicator - you are concise and articulate in speech and writing
  • Coursework or relative experience with data structures, algorithms, and debugging (Bonus if you’ve taken a course on distributed systems).
  • Practical knowledge of Java or any other object-oriented programming language.
    • What will you learn?
  • Build large-scale applications that solve complex business problems elegantly.
  • Distributed system design and architecture process
  • Writing high quality, performant, and industry-standard code
  • Working closely with business stakeholders in a fast-paced environment
    • What we use today
  • Java, Gradle, Spring Boot 2.x, gRPC, Atlas, Spinnaker, Elasticsearch, SQL, AWS, etc.
  • Note that you don't need to know all of these right now, but you should be excited to learn them!
    • Netflix is an equal opportunity employer that celebrates diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
