postings.text: Senior Machine Learning Scientist, Content Programming and Audience
postings.description:
Netflix is revolutionizing the entertainment industry with world-class technology. We serve over 200 million subscribers with streaming services in more than 190 countries around the world. We produce hundreds of new series, movies, documentaries, stand-up specials, and other categories of content each year. Because of our global footprint, we are able to elevate new types of creators, tell a diverse set of stories and inspire a worldwide audience, transcending geographical and cultural borders.

As Netflix continues to grow - we are leveraging the unique position we have as both a content distributor and producer to create a suite of causal inference models aimed at understanding what drives acquisition and retention on our service to support key decisions for our content acquisition teams. We are currently looking for a Machine Learning Scientist to join a team working on state-of-the-art machine learning models to help guide the future of the Netflix catalog and continue to bring joy to members all over the world.

To learn more about our research and analytics work, you can visit our research page here.

In this role, you will:

  • Be part of a team of best in class ML practitioners working on understanding how our content translates to revenue for Netflix
  • Develop ML models to support decisions by our finance and content teams- striving to answer the question, how can we create content that will continue to bring joy to our members?
  • Build robust causal models utilizing both external and internal data
  • Collaborate with analytics engineers and software engineers to translate your models into internal products that inform key decision-makers across the company
  • Develop data-driven approaches to understand the relationship between subscribers and content
  • Expose data and model predictions in a way that augments human expertise and informs decision-making
  • Communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences, including executive leadership

About you:

  • MS or Ph.D. in Economics, Computer Science, Cognitive Science or other related quantitative discipline with a strong foundation in statistics
  • 5+ years of experience as a hands-on expert-level practitioner of machine learning
  • You have built large-scale production ML models and systems
  • Strong coding experience in Python and SQL with experience with open source ML packages
  • Track record of innovation and having taken large machine learning-based products and features from conception to successfully delivering value to customers in production
  • Excellent communication skills and an ability to translate business context and intuition into data-oriented hypotheses to drive impact
  • You care deeply about the science being right, and equally as passionate about the translation to actionable insights

postings.text: Sr Software Engineer - Observability Platform
postings.description:
About Netflix
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

About Observability Platform
The Observability Platform team powers operational workflows and experiences by providing reusable, extensible, reliable services and infrastructure. We do this by enabling software engineers and data scientists to develop and run algorithms that analyze and act on real-time streams of billions of events reliably at scale. We offer configuration management, actioning, alerting, remediation capabilities and other services that can be leveraged to build various operational workflows centered around anomaly detection, analytics, diagnostics and operational insights. 

What you will do
You will architect and build platforms and services that process large sets of operational data in real-time to detect, diagnose and remediate anomalies in production. Real-time operational insight platforms need to scale with our rapid growth and global expansion and you can help influence that roadmap.

Who you are

  • Skilled in designing and writing HTTP and RESTful APIs
  • Passionate about building platforms that can be leveraged and extended by other engineers
  • Have knowledge of concurrency, resiliency, caching
  • Have designed, built and operated scalable, resilient services
  • Obsessed with customer satisfaction
  • Experience with observability is a plus

postings.text: Software Automation Engineer in Test, Marketing Technology
postings.description:
As Netflix produces more content and we expand our global presence, it becomes even more important to get people excited about content that’s right for them.  Promoting our titles happens on our consumer-facing product, and off the product through marketing and publicity.  To help consumers find the stories they’ll love, we need to make sure that we can scale our marketing and publicity efforts as well as deliver high quality experiences to customers around the world.

As a Software Automation Engineer in Test you will be responsible for the release pipeline for Netflix’s Media Center as well as other off-product sites created for specific marketing initiatives.  These off-product experiences are critical for promoting titles, so the infrastructure to support them needs a high degree of stability.

This is a high impact role where your contributions will not only make a difference in driving viewers to Netflix, but will also support the pipeline for mentoring new engineering talent joining the Studio organization. If you love product ideation, owning, collaborating, building, constantly raising the bar and growing others, you will thrive in this role!

Your Day-to-Day

  • Work cross-functionally with external vendors to manage systems and services to create infrastructure for promotional websites
  • Work with internal stakeholders to ensure that marketing launches are well supported
  • Evaluate new technologies to address scaling and reliability challenges across your portfolio
  • Work with other members of the team to plan ahead of major feature releases
  • Mentor other members of the team

Required Skills / Experience

  • 3+ years of experience in software automation
  • Familiarity with DevOps, release best practices and managing infrastructure as code
  • Excellent communication skills
  • You have practical knowledge of one or more programming languages (Python, Javascript or Java preferred).

Nice to haves

  • Familiarity with enterprise software development
  • Knowledge of Terraform or similar platform to orchestrate infrastructure
  • Experience developing applications using cloud computing platforms such as Amazon EC2, Azure, or Google Compute Engine
  • Previous work with geographically distributed teams

postings.text: Senior Front End Engineer - Production Management DSE
postings.description:
Netflix shows and films are produced around the world and watched by more than 208 million accounts globally, reaching new audiences every day. We aim to give content creators the opportunity to bring their most visionary ideas to life and create joy for our members around the world through innovative storytelling. 

The Production Management Data Science & Engineering team supports the operational and logistical side of the Studio, developing tools for Netflix teams managing content production around the world. We apply data science, analytics, and engineering to support Netflix’s continued growth in production and empower decision-makers throughout the Studio. Our team consists of Analytics Engineers, Front End Engineers, and Data Engineers who work directly with business partners to develop analytic tools, define core metrics, identify new data sources, deliver statistical insights, create intuitive visualizations, and more. This blog post describes some of the exciting problems we work on, and here’s an interview with one of our team’s very own Senior Analytics Engineers!  

We’re looking for a Senior Front End Engineer to help build data prototypes and analytic products to enable data-driven decisions as Studio teams plan and manage productions around the world. 

As a Senior Front End Engineer in this space, you will…

  • Partner closely with the Engineers (Analytics, Data, and Front End) on our team to scope, prototype, and scale custom tools to deliver analytic insights to the business 
  • Help elevate the impact of data in decision-making through intuitive, elegant solutions for both technical and non-technical audiences 
  • Drive the execution of your work, developing solutions that span from scrappy code and prototypes to high-visibility dashboards, applications, and visualizations that bring our data to life 
  • Collaborate with other Engineering teams at Netflix to build paved paths and define best practices across the Studio Product ecosystem 

You are…

  • A senior front end developer who can design and deploy rich, performant analytical applications
  • Excited to prototype and iterate to deliver results quickly versus wait for perfection 
  • Experienced in designing and building user interfaces with a strong sense of a holistic user experience, not just the individual pieces 
  • Comfortable making a variety of static and interactive visualizations for different audiences
  • Able to partner with and independently prioritize across a wide range of business contexts, teams, and partners 
  • Regularly employing these technical skills:
  • User Interface Design: You are thoughtful about using layout, color, and other design elements to develop user-friendly web applications
  • Data Visualization/Reporting: You are comfortable accessing, manipulating, and visualizing data using JavaScript frameworks such as Node, React, and D3 (or similar) and are familiar with testing, debugging, and deployment techniques. You have experience building responsive Web Applications using RESTful web services and processing JSON data. 
  • Queries: You are familiar with writing SQL to access and transform data.
  • Programming Languages: Familiarity with scripting languages for server side data manipulation such as Python (pandas/numpy), R, or bash is welcome but not required. 
Culture

You will have the opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way, working alongside smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. You will have the freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence decision-making in a fast paced, exciting environment. You can learn more about the Netflix culture at jobs.netflix.com/culture. 

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that an inclusive work environment builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

postings.text: Software Engineer, Mobile Developer Productivity Tools and Infrastructure
postings.description:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 200 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages.  Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen.  Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.  Our team sits at the intersection of this accelerating global growth, compounded with an ever increasing mobile usage for content consumption. We love every minute of the complex engineering and product challenges that come with operating at this scale.

Our Mobile Productivity (MoPro) team is focused on helping engineers around the world create the Netflix mobile applications quickly and with the highest levels of quality.  We do this with tools and infrastructure that optimizes the developer experience.  We tie it all together with sophisticated automated testing and productivity solutions designed to support our culture of experimentation, autonomy and ownership.   Our flagship mobile automation lab contains nearly 2000 real, physical device that execute hundreds of thousands of tests every day.  We tend to live by our values which will allow you to do your best work and grow.

We are looking for a software engineer who is passionate about evolving how we develop apps and who will drive innovation in mobile developer productivity and tools.  In this role, the impact of this work will enable engineering teams to build, integrate, test and monitor the Netflix mobile apps.  You are a force multiplier whose work will be felt by the entire Mobile engineering community at Netflix.  It involves cross functional collaboration with internal engineering and mobile automation infrastructure teams to propose, develop and deploy tooling designed to optimize core attributes of the developer experience, especially build, continuous integration, test and deployment systems.

What you will be doing:

  • Develop, maintain and constantly improve the mobile build ecosystem, packaging, continuous integration, continuous delivery (CI/CD), testing and release pipelines, 
  • Develop tools that are part of our build and test automation infrastructure with an eye on scaling and reliability
  • Innovatively create and develop techniques to automate manual activities in our mobile development process
  • Operate in a highly cross-functional environment where you can leverage multiple teams to help our partners be successful
  • Set direction and build consensus to drive long term positive impact on the mobile engineering ecosystem
  • Evangelize and drive adoption of software development best practices in code health, quality and test stability through frameworks and information sharing, not rules and process

Why Netflix?

  • The Netflix culture. Not just a memo, but something we practice daily.  A description of our unique culture may be found at https://jobs.netflix.com/life-at-netflix.
  • You will work with high performing, impactful and passionate engineers
  • You will help evolve Netflix’s offerings to include entertaining games
  • We pay top of market with excellent benefits
We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company.  We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

postings.text: Hardware Lab Engineer
postings.description:
Netflix is responsible for more than a third of the traffic on Internet access networks at peak times, and we’re working collaboratively with Internet Service Providers to ensure that our great content is delivered in a manner that is both highly efficient and cost effective. Today, we deliver 100% of Netflix content to 190 countries via Open Connect, our purpose-built content delivery network. We need great network professionals to help us manage the remarkable challenge and opportunity that this scale represents.

As a Hardware Lab Engineer, you will manage all hardware labs, build prototypes, and manage failure analysis across products.  You will work closely with other hardware engineering leads to complete testing, prototyping, and experiments along with enabling software development teams.

Qualifications:

  • Unix sysadmin proficiency
  • Network and TCP/IP Basics
  • Scripting for data collection and analytics
  • Computer internals understanding (PCI, Memory, Storage, CPU, GPU, Power, BIOS)
  • Basic understanding of web streaming

What you will be doing…

  • Maintaining multiple physical labs in multiple cities (travel required)
  • Building new prototype hardware for multiple products
  • Co-ordinating EFA of failed hardware
  • Maintaining test infrastructure for multiple development teams
  • Use lab measurement devices (power meters, sas analysers)

You will be successful in this role if you…

  • Self starter, curious, and not afraid to ask when in doubt
  • Are passionate about new technology
  • Thrive on learning new things
  • Understand data center power and data cabling (including -48v DC)
  • Effectively iterate on driver and software support for new hardware with vendors

Nice to have…

  • Masters or Bachelors degree in a relevant science or engineering field
  • Understanding of GPU internals
  • Server benchmarking experience

postings.text: Technical Product Manager, Studio Innovation (Animation Studio Technology)
postings.description:
*This position may be based out of either our Los Angeles or Los Gatos office.
 
It's an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We have grown to 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries. We’ve become one of the largest entertainment studios in the world, creating new original content at an incredible pace.  The Studio Innovation product team is front and center of this growth. We build software that fuels the production and creation of Netflix content. The Animation Studio Technology team within Studio Innovation builds products that power the Netflix Animation Studio ecosystem. Netflix is on a path to release six animation feature films per year, which no major studio has ever done, on top of the very healthy slate of animation series. 
 
We’re seeking ambitious, analytical, and technical product leaders to join our team. You will lead a cross-functional team of engineers, analysts, and other specialists to identify new ways to create products and services that drive impact in Animation. You will collaborate with global and regional business leaders to set a vision and chart a course. A successful candidate will have the creativity to look at problems in new ways and the willingness to try new things, a hypothesis-driven mentality, a balance of technical and analytical skills, and exceptional organizational leadership. The Animation team is growing at a rapid pace and needs a self-starter leader who has experience in strict prioritization and leveraging data to inform their decisions.
 
At Netflix, our product team is small so you have the opportunity to make a big impact, and our unique culture drives our approach to innovation. As a Product Manager on the Studio Product team, you will be expected to conceive, design and prioritize product initiatives based on your expertise and understanding of the landscape.  Though this is a senior role, you won’t have any direct reports. Instead, you will have the freedom to focus on significant business impact while orchestrating the work of stunning teams.

Responsibilities

  • Set a vision and strategy for the animation studio infrastructure and change the industry. You are responsible for developing innovative services, infrastructure and management tools required to contain and structure our animation studio production environment. 
  • Partner with the engineering team on how the 100-year-old Animation industry can be disrupted through technology. 
  • Lead a large cross-functional team to define a roadmap and execute innovative ideas. 
  • Develop, outline and maintain transaction volumes, SLAs for core infrastructure functions and workstations
  • Coordinate with platform teams around capabilities needed from underlying platform infrastructure
  • Foster a learn-fast mentality and collaborate with operational teams to roll out products to our talent, employees, and partners.
  • Work closely with data science and algorithm teams to generate insights and develop new ideas.
  • Thrive in a healthy debate of ideas while balancing to communicate your vision and strategy broadly throughout the organization. 

What We’re Looking For

  • Proven record of successfully launching technical products or creative platforms
  • Ability to prioritize well, and articulate your product roadmap across business functions and geographies, whether in small group discussions or large-scale presentations
  • Exceptional analytical skills 
  • Experience with new software development processes: discovery, design, engineering, soft launch
  • Experience leading, collaborating or working with engineering teams collectively
  • Willingness to regularly travel
  • Strong ability to dive into the unknown and create clarity amid chaos
  • Sharp assessment skills with an ability to vet wants vs. needs
  • Comfortable with running lean
  • Flexible amid an ever-changing and growing environment

Bonus Experience

  • Experience or education in technology or business domains. An undergraduate degree in computer science, engineering, or related disciplines, an MBA, or animation experience are a plus.

postings.text: Senior Network Engineer
postings.description:
Netflix is responsible for a significant percentage of Internet traffic at peak times, and we are working collaboratively with Internet Service Providers to ensure that our great content is delivered in a manner that is both highly efficient and cost effective. Today, we deliver 100% of Netflix content from Open Connect, our purpose-built content delivery network. We need great network professionals to help us manage the remarkable challenge and opportunity that this scale represents.

The Open Connect team’s mission is to provide a high quality video streaming experience for our customers at a continually declining cost. The Open Connect Network Engineering group is focused on engineering and operation of the Open Connect Global backbone and egress connectivity to partners that is integral to our streaming service and also underpins the networking needs of our employees and content creators worldwide.

The Open Connect Network Engineering group is recruiting for a Senior Network Engineer.  We are looking for the following characteristics in candidates. 

A highly communicative individual who will:

  • Interact with team members to operate, maintain and upgrade the Open Connect network infrastructure deployed in 80+ locations worldwide 
  • Work cross-functionally with internal teams and vendors to manage our continuous growth around the globe, with a strong focus on maintaining the high level of Quality of Experience (QoE) for Netflix’s users. This would include the Deployment, Provisioning and ISP Partner Engagement teams with regards ongoing egress and network capacity needs.
  • Collaborate with partners, carriers, data center providers and our hardware vendors to manage and troubleshoot the network (circuits, cross connects and trouble case management)
  • Contribute and collaborate with members of our Network Architecture team to implement and support complex network designs while providing operational considerations and constructive feedback
  • Contribute and collaborate with members of our Network Tools team to develop a high level of automation to increase accuracy and decrease timeframes for day-to-day activities
  • Have strong written and verbal skills for documentation and collaboration
  • When in doubt, and after exhausting self-help resources available, exercise curiosity by leveraging the opinions of colleagues by seeking additional context or clarification as described within the Netflix Culture memo

Your skills and experience should include:

  • Relevant professional experience 
  • Expert knowledge of large scale multi-vendor wide area networks (Arista, Cisco, Juniper)
  • Expert knowledge of IP routing, particularly BGP and IS-IS
  • Experience with the internet ecosystem, including the concepts of interconnection, peering, and transit
  • Experience with MPLS, QoS and DWDM concepts and technologies
  • Familiarity in network automation with experience using Python 
This position includes rotating on-call assignment and occasional travel (quarterly offsites / conferences)

postings.text: Senior UI Engineer
postings.description:
Studio UI builds the user experiences used by our internal and external creative partners producing original content. With well over 180 million paid memberships and growing, our UIs enable the entire workflow of content production, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. 

You’ll have a direct impact on how the Netflix studio creates and produces shows on a global scale. With an increasing slate of original content being produced every year, our tools manage billions of dollars worth of content spend. Join us to leverage your full-stack JavaScript and UI expertise to help our creatives create the next big hit!

People who do well on this team are self-motivated engineers with a passion for our business and for technology innovation. We look for individuals with deep knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, and HTML who are comfortable writing custom JavaScript but also know when to apply off-the-shelf solutions for the problem. We also value people who are passionate about user experience and have an eye for improving the UI. We currently work with TypeScript, React, GraphQL, and Node.js, however the ability to adapt with changing technology is an important strength. 

Opportunities to Make an Impact

  • Accurately forecast, budget, and record the financials that are the backbone of our studio
  • Empower our content buyers to discover, evaluate, and procure the next Netflix original
  • Allow the discovery and management of talent and vendors that work on our productions
  • Connect the seams of our ecosystem of tools together in the form of connected, end-to-end workflows
  • Enable our productions to coordinate on set in real-time, modernizing a 100 year old, paper-based workflow
  • Help content creators promote and analyze content, covering all aspects of setup, acquisition, fulfillment, management, and publishing needed for content to go live
  • Revolutionize how we prepare our titles for distribution on our consumer-facing platforms
  • Amplify and accelerate our engineering teams by crafting highly usable tools, workflows, and solutions to improve end user productivity and development joy

What sets you apart

  • Passion for building high-impact, well-performing user experiences
  • Experienced building single-page applications in JavaScript/TypeScript 
  • Independent, proactive, and able to deliver production-ready code with minimal guidance
  • Great communication and collaboration skills working cross-functionally with other engineers, product managers, and designers

Why Netflix?

  • We’re bringing unique stories from around the world to a global audience at a scale never done before
  • You’ll work with other senior, high-performing engineers so you will be constantly learning and sharpening your skill set
  • You’ll collaborate with product managers and designers, data scientists and algorithm experts, even content executives and content creators, to build exciting new features
  • We pay top of market with excellent benefits
  • Our culture is something we strive to constantly improve and practice daily
  • We have a lot of fun bringing wild ideas to life at Hack Day!

postings.text: Senior UI Engineer - Studio Animation UI Engineering
postings.description:
Netflix is reinventing the way the world watches movies and television. Over 204 million members around the globe already enjoy our award-winning content, but most of our growth still lies ahead. To support this, we continue to expand our content budget and are experiencing hyper-growth within our Studio User Interface team.

The Studio Animation UI team is a part of our larger User Interface team focused on studio applications. Our engineering team builds tools for creators and the teams that support them. We work closely with the newly created Netflix Animation Studios. Because of this, we are looking for team members who are locally near the Animation studio. 

People who do well on this team are self-motivated engineers with a passion for our business and for technology innovation. We look for individuals with deep knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, and HTML who are comfortable writing custom JavaScript but also know when to apply off-the-shelf solutions for the problem. We also value people who are passionate about user experience and have an eye for improving the UI. We currently work with TypeScript, React, GraphQL, and Node.js, but the ability to adapt to changing technology is an important strength. Any experience with WebAssembly, WebRTC, Web Audio API, and web sockets would be a bonus.  

Our team includes people of all genders, sexual orientation, parents, the self-taught, the university-educated, and people of a wide variety of nationalities, ages, and socio-economic backgrounds. Diverse teams are strong teams, and we encourage those with varied identities, backgrounds, and experiences to apply.

Opportunities to Make an Impact

  • Build UIs that help creators do their best work
  • Empower our talent teams to find and retain the best animation talent in the world
  • Join a dream team of Senior UI Engineers to drive innovation within the Netflix Studio UI organization to champion product excellence

What Sets You Apart

  • Passion for building high-impact, well-performing user experiences
  • Experience building single-page applications in JavaScript/TypeScript 
  • Independent, proactive, and able to deliver production-ready code with minimal guidance
  • Great communication and collaboration skills working cross-functionally with other engineers, product managers, and designers

Why Netflix?

  • We’re bringing unique stories from around the world to a global audience at a scale never done before
  • You’ll work with other senior, high-performing engineers so you will be constantly learning and sharpening your skillset
  • You’ll collaborate with product managers and designers, data scientists and algorithm experts, even content executives and content creators, to build exciting new features
  • We pay top of market with excellent benefits
  • Our culture is something we strive to constantly improve and practice daily
  • We have a lot of fun bringing wild ideas to life at Hack Day!

What We Use Today

  • To build our clients: JavaScript, TypeScript, React, GraphQL
  • To build our servers: JavaScript, TypeScript, Node.js, GraphQL, gRPC
  • Note that you don't need to know all of these right now, but you should be excited to learn them!

postings.text: Sr. Software Engineer - Cloud Gateway
postings.description:
About Netflix:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 214 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, feature films and mobile games across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

Do you want to be part of the team that develops, owns and operates Netflix’s “Front Door”? The Cloud Gateway is powered by our open source project, Zuul.  We handle, route, and control all device and web traffic going to Netflix's cloud services for our more than 214 million members in 190 countries, spanning 3 AWS regions. Games are our next big frontier and an incredible opportunity to deliver new experiences to delight and entertain our quickly growing membership.The gateway thus needs to be the most highly available service in Netflix's cloud infrastructure as a Zuul failure means nobody can stream Netflix and enjoy the Gaming experience.

Zuul is arguably the genre-defining gateway in the industry. We are pushing the envelope of how and what a layer 7 gateway does. Some of the interesting and innovative features that we provide include traffic shaping, DDOS protection, resiliency, advanced self serviceable routing, deep insights, push notifications, and much more. RoleWe are seeking an enthusiastic engineer who is interested in building innovative tools and features to support our direct partners, such as device, web, playback and API services, studio, reliability, and operations teams. Your ideas and skills will create important new features and systems that will directly impact Netflix’s front door traffic and systems.

About the Role
We are seeking an enthusiastic engineer who is interested in building innovative tools and features to support our direct partners, such as device, web, playback and API services, studio, reliability, and operations teams. Your ideas and skills will create important new features and systems that will directly impact Netflix’s front door traffic and systems. 

Skills that will help you be successful

  • You have experience working on and operating either complex systems or large scale. 
  • You want to build and operate highly reliable, easy-to-use, impactful systems.
  • You are great at communication and are partner / customer-focused. 
  • You are well versed in Java or other object-oriented languages.  
  • You have experience or aptitude for highly available systems
  • You have a solid understanding of transport and application layer protocols (HTTP, HTTP/2, WebSockets, etc). 
  • You enjoy working with and building partnerships with different teams across the company.
  • You’ve read about Netflix’s culture and think you would thrive here.
Here are a few recent talks and posts from members of our team that highlight some of the work we do:

Scalable Anomaly Detection (with Zero Machine Learning)
Zuul's Journey to Non-Blocking
AWS re: Invent 2018: Scaling Push Messaging for Millions of Netflix Devices 
Open Sourcing Zuul 2
Zuul 2 - Netflix Journey to async non-blocking systems
Rethinking Netflix's Edge Load Balancing
Show Must Go On: Securing Netflix Studios At Scale

postings.text: Engineering Manager, Enterprise Software Engineering
postings.description:
At Netflix, we are shaping the future of global entertainment, bringing moments of joy to 200+ million customers. The Enterprise Software Engineering team drives productivity and operational efficiency for our corporate teams and the employees through business automation, workflow optimizations and targeted technology solutions. We focus on building custom enterprise applications that cater to the unique needs of our customers and keep our business functioning smoothly. 

We are looking for an experienced Engineering Manager to lead a suite of enterprise applications and drive engineering solutions to fruition. As an engineering leader, you will drive strategic enterprise programs in Talent, Corporate Operations, Travel and Legal operations domain, streamline the development of multiple critical initiatives and define the long term technology roadmap to support the product priorities.

Responsibilities:
As an engineering manager, you’ll be responsible for technical direction, implementation and execution of key enterprise applications.  You’ll partner closely with product management, product designers and cross functional partners to craft and evolve the vision, mission, and strategy on team projects.  You’ll help implement effective project logistics that emphasize quality and drive progress.  You'll create and fulfill the engineering hiring plan for the team, including sourcing  and interviewing. You’ll develop a diverse and inclusive team where team members are empowered to do their best work. You'll mentor engineers and look for opportunities to advance  their careers while keeping them engaged and focused on the product and the company vision.  


About you:
You are self driven, passionate, have developed engineering strategies and have a strong track record of delivering high-quality prod.  You thrive in a fast paced development environment with an ability to make rapid decisions.  You can deal with ambiguous situations, remove obstacles and guide your team to find the optimal product solutions.  You have experience working with a diverse group of cross functional peers - product, design, data science, and business stakeholders driving technical direction and decision making. You are adept at solving complex technical problems and removing roadblocks so your team can focus on delivery of the projects. You enjoy coaching, mentoring and developing a strong engineering team and do not shy away from having the tough conversations when needed.

The ideal candidate is someone who has:

  • 5+ years of software engineering experience with 3+ years of experience building and leading teams
  • Solid understanding of software engineering fundamentals and software delivery process
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Expertise in hiring diverse teams, creating an inclusive environment and retaining top talent
  • Experience working with product, design, business and leadership in setting the long term strategic direction for team and products
  • Experience with effectively creating alignments with multiple teams and operating well in ambiguity

postings.text: Senior Analytics Engineer - Data Products and Partnerships
postings.description:
We’re looking for an analytics minded data scientist or engineer who knows how to develop compelling data products with a strong visual focus and is great at nurturing partnerships with stakeholders.

Netflix entertains the world. Our 200+ million members stream award-winning content from 190 countries. Every one of these streams is served from our custom-built content delivery network, Open Connect, which comprises over 18,000 servers installed in over 5,000 sites across the world. In order to deliver a great experience to our members, we partner with over 2,000 ISPs globally to embed these servers in their networks. Understanding how we can deepen relationships with our ISP partners and how to manage the growth of Open Connect requires great data and actionable insights. It also requires that data be easily accessible by the teams at Netflix who are engaged with our ISP partners so they can build better strategies suited to their particular needs.

As a Senior Analytics Engineer you will join the team of Analytics Engineers, Data Engineers, and Data Scientists who partner with Open Connect to build tools that help make better decisions using data. You will work closely with the teams in Open Connect who are responsible for managing ISP relationships and planning for future growth, to understand where data and insights can deliver value. You will design metrics, build tools to explore data, and work with our Data Engineering partners to develop production grade data pipelines. You will also work closely with the larger data and analytics organization to drive adoption of analytics standards and to ensure that Open Connect benefits from Netflix-wide analytics platform initiatives.

What you bring

  • Passion for using data to help guide strategic decision making.
  • You know how to tell stories using metrics and data.
  • You can execute compelling data visualizations with dashboard tools like Looker or Tableau. 
  • Extensive experience building visualizations using JavaScript and frameworks like D3 or Semiotic is a plus, but some experience with the appetite to grow required.
  • Experience building data pipelines and ETL in languages like SQL and workflow orchestration tools like Apache Airflow
  • Fluency with at least one analytics and scripting language like Python or R
  • You build strong relationships with stakeholders and colleagues to tackle big, cross-functional problems
  • A good product sense: you know how to get at what our partners need and how to develop solutions to satisfy those needs
  • Exceptional communication with technical and non-technical audiences 
  • Comfort with ambiguity: ability to thrive with minimal oversight and process
Netflix's culture is key to our success. We celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams, and we approach inclusion equally seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
To learn more about our work, visit our research page.

postings.text: Senior Computer Vision Engineer, Artwork and Video DSE
postings.description:
Our mission at Netflix is to connect global stories with global audiences. When a Netflix member opens our app, we have a few precious moments to help them choose a story that is right for them at that instance. Presenting them evidence – Artwork, Trailers, Synopses – that authentically represents each title and resonates with the member is essential to this effort.

Getting this evidence just right for each title is a tall order but our creative strategists, art designers, and video editors are masters of this. Perhaps a more unique aspect of Netflix is that these teams deeply leverage data to inform their decision making as they go about creative tasks like designing artwork & cutting trailers or clips. This is made possible because Netflix UI is a thriving learning machine where Artwork & Video assets are personalized via reinforcement learning. 

Given this data & insights rich landscape, we are looking for a Senior Machine Learning Engineer to build new algorithmic products in this space. You will use world-class engineering and machine learning techniques on real-world, internal and external big data to directly impact creative production in a multi-modal setting (image, text, audio and video).

What you will do in this role:

  • You will Independently develop ML and deep learning models in a multi-modal setting (image, text, audio and video).
  • Drive solutions to increase the team’s ML model portfolio while navigating an ambiguous problem space.
  • Partner with engineers, creatives, and researchers  in a two-way exchange of ideas and best practices.
  • Communicate results to a variety of audiences, technical and non-technical.
  • Enact Netflix values in daily work and interactions.

About you:

  • MS or PhD in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Applied Statistics, Mathematics, or related field. PhD is a plus. 
  • 5+ years of experience as a hands-on expert-level practitioner of machine learning and leading large ML initiatives across cross-functional teams in multiple organizations. 
  • Excellent communication skills and an ability to translate business context and intuition into data-oriented hypotheses to drive impact.
  • Strong coding experience (e.g. Python, PyTorch, TensorFlow).
  • Passion for and an appreciation of the entertainment industry is definitely a plus.
  • The Netflix culture resonates with you.

postings.text: Product Designer , Studio XD - Media Developer Experience
postings.description:
Overview
Netflix is the leading provider of streaming video, reaching over 200 million paid subscribers in more than 190 countries and territories worldwide. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen, all without commercials or commitments.

At the center of every single title that launches on the service is a huge effort across multiple teams to curate and deliver the best representation of that title from the artwork to the synopsis.

The Studio XD team designs a suite of products to improve the operations behind taking a title live, while building the world’s deepest catalog of information about tv shows and movies. As part of the Studio XD Design Team you will use the power of design to help the world’s largest studio source, manage, produce, and deliver incredible content to members all around the world.
 
About the Studio XD team
We are the newest and fastest-growing design team at Netflix.
 
We design the technologies that power how Netflix sources and produces all our content. We are scrappy and entrepreneurial. Each of us has a broad set of Product Design skills ranging from product thinking to interaction design, user research to visual communication. We work in close collaboration with Product, Engineering, and Consumer Insights partners to build groundbreaking innovations for the people inside and outside of our Studio.
 
The organization is flat, process is minimal, individual responsibility is big, and there is an emphasis on keeping non-productive influences out of the everyday decision process.
 
About the role
As a Media Foundations Designer, you will focus on the engineers and technical directors that power our global production teams. These are the people creating software tools and automations to help productions operate more smoothly and enable artists to work together to tell amazing stories. 

You’ll collaborate closely with product managers, researchers, data scientists, engineers, and studio partners to unpack user needs, inform strategy, and design innovative solutions for the unique problems pipeline engineers face.

This team is at the forefront of redefining how films and TV shows are created - the challenges are exciting and the potential for impact on Netflix and the industry at large is huge.

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with product, data science, business, and engineering partners to lead and develop product and design strategies for pipeline engineering tooling
  • Work with data science, studio partners, and consumer insights teams to gain a deep understanding of users and their needs.
  • Advocate for the user and create a holistic UX vision that inspires the wider Media Foundations team to push beyond the status quo.
  • Bring multiple stakeholders along the journey while you solve their most challenging problems for the business.
  • Assess complex workflows and create simple, intuitive, and scalable product experiences that improve our ability to support production needs.

The Must-Haves

  • 8+ years of Product Design experience designing a mix of consumer and enterprise products.
  • Multiple successful product launches that drove meaningful impact to the business.
  • Experience designing complex workflows that scale across diverse, global teams.
  • Ability to rapidly ideate, produce, and test multiple UX/UI concepts and prototypes.
  • Expertise in engineering tooling and software development workflows
  • Expertise in working directly with partners to make progress on priorities.
  • Skills in communicating your concepts and promoting their potential positive impact.
  • Experience working in fast-paced, continuous delivery environments.
  • A willingness to fail, learn, and share your findings with your colleagues.
  • Ego-free and earnest—you welcome candid feedback and constructively give it.
  • Passion for entertainment, filmmaking, and storytelling.

postings.text: Senior Analytics Engineer, Creative Excellence
postings.description:
Netflix is a global leader in entertainment with over 200 million members in 190 countries. Our content creative excellence team strives to connect people with stories that bring them joy across the world. We are passionate about engaging storytelling and supporting our content partners using analytical insights along the title creation pipeline.

Our creative excellence team creates actionable metrics that inspire and inform creative teams to improve the excellence of their stories from a member perspective. We work cross functionally developing measurement frameworks that enable learnings and improvements. We use analytics to develop actionable insights that improve the creative excellence of our titles and overall content slate.

We are seeking a talented Senior Analytics Engineer to lead analysis, insights and tooling projects with our business stakeholders. This role features ample opportunity for project ownership, and to have tangible impacts that benefit data-driven decision making across the Netflix Content and Content Strategy and Analytics organizations. In success, you will collaborate on existing priorities but also will propose, develop and execute on new analytical opportunities. You’ll help set our strategic agenda in the analytics space, ramp up on new tools required to guide projects to completion, track down bugs, and everything in between.

In this role, you will:

  • Collaborate closely with data scientists, engineers, CS&A, and Content to deliver insights through statistical analyses, modeling and/or dashboards that drive key decisions.
  • Be a strategic thought partner with business stakeholders to define high impact analytical problems and innovative ways to solve them with data.
  • Design, build and automate business metrics into self-serve dashboards to tell a story. Assist and educate on interpretation. 
  • Find ways to automate and scale repeated ad-hoc requests.
  • Research and develop key metrics and performance indicators.  For example, what’s the value of our members rewatching our titles? 
  • Translate analytical insights into concrete, actionable recommendations to our content teams for decision making.

About you:

  • Strong experience in scripting with SQL and Python, extracting large sets of data, and design of ETL flows.
  • Proven track record in transforming large amounts of complex data into insights by leading the end-to-end creation of intuitive data products.
  • Passionate about communicating difficult concepts to non-technical audiences.
  • Self-starter who thrives under a high level of autonomy.
  • Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Enthusiastic about Netflix culture.

postings.text: Senior JavaScript Engineer - Studio UI
postings.description:
This position is open for both our Los Angeles and Los Gatos locations, as well as for remote work within the US.

Studio UI builds the user experiences used by our internal and external creative partners producing original content. With well over 180 million paid memberships and growing, our UIs enable the entire workflow of content production, from pitch to play, and provide innovative new ways to develop and manage entertainment at scale. 

You’ll have a direct impact on how the Netflix studio creates and produces shows on a global scale. With an increasing slate of original content being produced every year, our tools manage billions of dollars worth of content spend. Join us to leverage your full-stack JavaScript and UI expertise to help our creatives create the next big hit!

People who do well on this team are self-motivated engineers with a passion for our business and for technology innovation. We look for individuals with deep knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, and HTML who are comfortable writing custom JavaScript but also know when to apply off-the-shelf solutions for the problem. We also value people who are passionate about user experience and have an eye for improving the UI. We currently work with TypeScript, React, GraphQL, and Node.js, however the ability to adapt with changing technology is an important strength. 

Opportunities to Make an Impact

  • Accurately forecast, budget, and record the financials that are the backbone of our studio
  • Empower our content buyers to discover, evaluate, and procure the next Netflix original
  • Allow the discovery and management of talent and vendors that work on our productions
  • Connect the seams of our ecosystem of tools together in the form of connected, end-to-end workflows
  • Enable our productions to coordinate on set in real-time, modernizing a 100 year old, paper-based workflow
  • Help content creators promote and analyze content, covering all aspects of setup, acquisition, fulfillment, management, and publishing needed for content to go live
  • Revolutionize how we prepare our titles for distribution on our consumer-facing platforms
  • Amplify and accelerate our engineering teams by crafting highly usable tools, workflows, and solutions to improve end user productivity and development joy

What Sets You Apart

  • Passion for building high-impact, well-performing user experiences
  • Experienced building single-page applications in JavaScript/TypeScript 
  • Independent, proactive, and able to deliver production-ready code with minimal guidance
  • Great communication and collaboration skills working cross-functionally with other engineers, product managers, and designers

Why Netflix?

  • We’re bringing unique stories from around the world to a global audience at a scale never done before
  • You’ll work with other senior, high-performing engineers so you will be constantly learning and sharpening your skill set
  • You’ll collaborate with product managers and designers, data scientists and algorithm experts, even content executives and content creators, to build exciting new features
  • We pay top of market with excellent benefits
  • Our culture is something we strive to constantly improve and practice daily
  • We have a lot of fun bringing wild ideas to life at Hack Day!

postings.text: Technical Program Manager - Data Infrastructure
postings.description:
Netflix
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries that enjoy TV series, documentaries, and feature films in more than 30 different languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are always looking to help members find their next favorite story.

Our story
Platform Engineering is focused on providing technical products, tools, and services that enable Netflix to scale and innovate. We want to empower Netflix engineers to focus on building innovative experiences for our members and creators around the world. We deploy hundreds of services, on thousands of instances, across multiple regions, and millions of client devices. Platform Engineering Teams focus on increasing agility, efficiency, and reliability across our compute, networking, productivity, and data products.

Within Platform Engineering, the Data platform organization helps Netflix maximize the value of data by enabling teams to easily store, discover, and utilize data. The team provides data-related infrastructure for software engineering (e.g. data stores), data engineering (e.g. batch and stream processing), and analytics (e.g. Tableau).  Ensure that we appropriately account for broad concerns such as cost, privacy, and security. 

The Role
We are looking for an experienced technical program manager that will be focused on large cross-functional data infrastructure and big data-related programs that impact all of engineering at Netflix. This individual will partner closely with product managers, engineering managers, engineers, and other technical program managers to execute complex technical programs. If you’re looking for a technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you!

What you will do

  • Lead multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with technical teams (including product, engineering, UI/UX, Data Science, etc), that focus on building a scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure foundation
  • Leverage deep technical domain expertise to drive technical strategy, planning, and execution with engineering partners
  • Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership
  • Champion breaking out OKRs into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays
  • Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly

What we are looking for: Functional Skills

  • You can partner with multiple cross-functional teams to define technical strategy and requirements
  • You are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies
  • You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches and weigh in on product vs technology tradeoffs
  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health
  • You have a data-driven mindset in your decision making
  • You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise
  • You have domain expertise in one of the following areas: cloud infrastructure, engineering productivity, or data

What we are looking for: Basic Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience driving large scale SW projects with engineering and product teams
  • 4+ years of software engineering, systems engineering, or technical product/program management experience
  • Experience managing projects across cross-functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience
  • Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction

What we are looking for: Additive Qualifications

  • Experience in big data, compute platforms, data stores, analytics platforms, etc. 
  • Migration experience, moving from from on-prem to cloud architecture 
  • Data security/privacy architecture understanding

postings.text: Senior Security Support Engineer
postings.description:
Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.
 
About the Security Operations and Support Team
To enable our Information Security organization to effectively and sustainably scale our teams’ ability to provide excellent customer support, we are forming a new Security Operations and Support team within our Security Operations Center (SOC). This team will be the frontline resource for all information security needs of our customers (i.e., our workforce) and will be responsible for handling, troubleshooting, and resolving customer requests and issues. As one of the founding members of this team, you will have tremendous influence over the vision, development, implementation, and operations.
 
The Role 
For this role, we are looking for a Senior Security Support Engineer with a passion for information security operations, customer service, and automation. You will be responsible for monitoring and handling our customers’ information security requests, troubleshooting and solving security issues, automating support needs, developing support documentation and runbooks, developing and maintaining tools and infrastructure, and seeking out ways to continuously improve the security support experience.
 
Our ideal new team member has first-hand experience working in customer-facing, security engineering support roles and has a breadth of experience across information security, system and network administration, and cloud computing. You are excellent at understanding and solving complex and ambiguous problems and constantly seek improvement. 

What you’ll need to be successful:

  • You have excellent written and verbal communications skills.
  • You have experience providing excellent customer service across a complex organization, ideally as part of a central support team.
  • You have strong collaboration skills and experience working with cross-functional teams.
  • You possess a breadth of knowledge and experience across the information security domain, such as endpoint security, encryption, SIEM, identity management, application security, and vulnerability management.
  • You have experience in implementing security tools and managing infrastructure.
  • You have experience in system and network administration across multiple platforms and environments, to include AWS.
  • You have experience in developing tools, scripts, and automations.
  • You seek out process improvement opportunities through automation.
  • You have hands-on experience analyzing and responding to security events, such as conducting log analysis, developing queries and analytics, troubleshooting security issues, and correlating diverse data sets.
Netflix allows the security team to approach security differently. We’ve shaped our security principles to align with our culture of “Freedom and Responsibility” and “Context not Control.” Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility and the accountability to do the right thing for Netflix. Read more about the Netflix culture here.
 
We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

postings.text: Senior Technical Support Engineer
postings.description:
Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with 208 million paid memberships in over 190 countries, enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. 

About the Engineering Support Organization
To enable Productivity Engineering to effectively and sustainably scale the support they provide to their customers, we are forming a new Engineering Support Organization within this group. The new team will serve as the frontline resource for all engineering support needs of our customers (i.e., our workforce) by handling, troubleshooting, and resolving customer requests and issues. In addition, the team will focus on ways of working, customer advocacy, support tooling, platform product offerings, documentation, and developer education. As one of the founding members, you will have tremendous influence over this critical team’s vision, development, implementation, and operations. 

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, allowing you to do your best work and grow. To learn more about Productivity Engineering, feel free to listen to this podcast. 

The Role 
We are looking for a Senior Support Engineer with a passion for productivity infrastructure and tooling, customer service, and automation for this role. You will be responsible for monitoring and handling our customers’ requests, troubleshooting, solving issues, automating support needs, developing support documentation and runbooks, developing and maintaining support tools and automation, understanding our product offerings, and seeking ways to improve the engineering support experience continuously. 

Our ideal new team member has first-hand experience working in customer-facing, engineering support roles and has knowledge of infrastructure, internal tooling, platforms, and cloud computing. You are excellent at understanding and solving complex and ambiguous problems and constantly seek improvement. As an Engineer in this role, we need a candidate who can understand our complex offerings on a technical level, be hands-on in the development of our support automation tooling, and recommend product and operational improvements based on customer interactions.

Location
Remote is an option. We value what you can do from anywhere in the United States.
Our offices are located in Los Gatos.

What you’ll need to be successful:

  • You have a minimum of 3 years of professional engineering experience
  • You excel in developing tools and scripts and seek out process improvement opportunities through automation
  • You are skilled in providing superior customer support across a complex organization, ideally as part of a central team
  • You obsess over customer experience
  • You are a data-driven decision-maker
  • You have excellent written and verbal communications skills and appreciate the importance of comprehensive documentation
  • You have strong collaboration skills and experience working with cross-functional teams
We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

postings.text: Senior Security Operations Engineer
postings.description:
Netflix is the world’s leading streaming entertainment service with 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.
 
About the Security Operations Team
As Netflix has grown, so has our approach to security operations. For a considerable time, a strategy of building around human operations work kept us from investing in a Security Operations Center (SOC). As organizational size and complexity, cross-spectrum threats (i.e., physical), and non-automatable security events have increased, so has the demand for an expert information security operations team. This is not your traditional tiered SOC. This is a team that seeks to define what a modern SOC can be, focused on developing automations and other solutions that scale. As one of the founding members of our newly forming Security Operations team, you will have tremendous influence over its vision, development, implementation, and operations.
 
The Role 
For this role, we are looking for a curious and innovative Senior Security Operations Engineer with a passion for information security operations and automation development. You will develop and maintain tools, detections, automations, runbooks, processes, analytics, dashboards, and metrics to support rapid detection, triage, analysis, and response to potential security threats.  You will be responsible for responding to and investigating security alerts and proactively hunting for malicious activity across the organization.

What you’ll need to be successful:

  • You have excellent written and verbal communications skills.
  • You possess a breadth of knowledge and experience across the information security domain, such as endpoint security, SIEM, IDS, identity management, vulnerability management, incident response, and threat intelligence.
  • You have hands-on experience analyzing and responding to security events, such as conducting log analysis, developing queries and analytics, troubleshooting security issues, and correlating diverse data sets.
  • You have experience in developing and implementing security tools and managing infrastructure.
  • You have experience in building and maintaining security data pipelines.
  • You have experience in system and network administration across multiple platforms and environments, to include AWS.
  • You seek out and develop process improvement opportunities through automation.
Netflix allows the security team to approach security differently. We’ve shaped our security principles to align with our culture of “Freedom and Responsibility” and “Context not Control.” Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility and the accountability to do the right thing for Netflix. Read more about the Netflix culture here.
 
The majority of our team are located in Los Angeles and Los Gatos, CA. If you are US-based but not interested in relocating near Los Angeles or Los Gatos, you should have experience operating with remote teams and be willing to frequently travel to California.

We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

postings.text: Director of Product Management, Member Experiences
postings.description:
The Netflix member product team is responsible for innovating and evolving how our members discover and enjoy our service around the world. Netflix is looking for a seasoned product management leader to drive our member product experience. In this role, you will help define the future of entertainment discovery and consumption for a rapidly growing audience of over two hundred million consumers globally.

Our purpose is to entertain the world. To do so, we connect our customers to stories that they love in a way that resonates with them. To succeed, our service must be engaging and intuitive across all devices and in all markets: not a small challenge.

We are data-driven and want someone who is comfortable using data to inform priorities and assess test results. At the same time, we are looking for a product leader who demonstrates customer empathy and has solid instincts. In this role, it’s your job to inspire and influence the team by articulating and continuously reinforcing the product vision.

In this role, you will:

  • Take product concepts from idea through validation, shipping, measurement, and iteration.
  • Work as part of an autonomous agile team along with experienced designers, engineers, consumer insights, and data science & analytics teams to deliver outstanding products to our customers.
  • Author strategy documents (memos) and presentations, and represent your team’s work to senior executives and content partners.
  • Work with your data science and analytics counterparts to build business cases and interpret results from a/b tests.
  • Work with your consumer insights and experience design partners to deeply understand and socialize the evolving needs of our customers, content team, and partners.

We offer:

  • The opportunity to have impact. The Netflix product management model is different from most technology companies. Our key product management leaders - including this position - work with multiple sprint teams but do not have direct reports. Consequently, we’re looking for experienced product leaders who are strategic and also like rolling up their sleeves. Our PM teams are intentionally small to allow for broad ownership for each leader.
  • Responsibility. Netflix offers true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate.
  • Learning. You will be creating customer experiences and business models that have never been done before. You will have the opportunity to work with stunning colleagues who value collaboration and from whom you can learn.
  • A work environment where you can grow your career. Many of our top execs started out as individual contributors.

Required Qualifications:

  • 10+ years experience in product development
  • 5+ years technology product management with agile teams, with responsibility across a portfolio of products or services 
  • 3+ years mass-market consumer software products
  • Solid understanding of mobile and web technologies and user experience design patterns, and the innate curiosity and desire to learn more. 
  • Understanding of quantitative research methods such as AB testing and analytics
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience in engineering, technical program management, product design, or analytics
  • Experience with entertainment content production or distribution
  • Strong public speaking and presentation skills
  • Computer science degree or equivalent
We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and better products for our customers.

    • We offer:
  • The opportunity to have impact. The Netflix product management model is different from most technology companies. Our key product management leaders - including this position - work with multiple sprint teams but do not have direct reports. Consequently, we’re looking for experienced product leaders who are strategic and also like rolling up their sleeves. Our PM teams are intentionally small to allow for broad ownership for each leader.
  • Responsibility. Netflix offers true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate.
  • Learning. You will be creating customer experiences and business models that have never been done before. You will have the opportunity to work with stunning colleagues who value collaboration and from whom you can learn.
  • A work environment where you can grow your career. Many of our top execs started out as individual contributors.
    • Required Qualifications:
  • 10+ years experience in product development
  • 5+ years technology product management with agile teams, with responsibility across a portfolio of products or services 
  • 3+ years mass-market consumer software products
  • Solid understanding of mobile and web technologies and user experience design patterns, and the innate curiosity and desire to learn more. 
  • Understanding of quantitative research methods such as AB testing and analytics
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills
    • Preferred Qualifications:
  • Experience in engineering, technical program management, product design, or analytics
  • Experience with entertainment content production or distribution
  • Strong public speaking and presentation skills
  • Computer science degree or equivalent
    • We strongly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and better products for our customers.

postings.text: Manager, Resilience Engineering
postings.description:
About Netflix

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

The Big Picture:

To support such a large subscriber base, we run a large, distributed, and ever-changing system. The Resilience Engineering team’s role is to make this complex system as well understood as possible to reduce the risk of making changes in our production environment. 

The Resilience Engineering team finds vulnerabilities, risks, and limits in our system before they lead to large-scale issues. To do this, we’ve built an Infrastructure Experimentation platform, which Netflix Engineers use to safely experiment with their services in production. Our platform runs controlled chaos, load, and software change experiments in production so that engineers can better understand the limits of their application and the Netflix ecosystem. 

Our production environment is complex, as are the platforms the team builds and operates. We are looking for an engineering manager to join our team that is comfortable with ambiguity, but also great at driving ambiguity down. We need someone that will help us realize the big opportunities we have in this evolving domain. As our team works closely with our partner teams at Netflix, being skilled at building relationships and cross-team collaboration is a must. We aren’t looking for someone that wants to write code or design systems, but it will be difficult for you to be successful if you don't understand how distributed systems work and what makes them fail, especially at scale.

Who you are:

  • You have a passion and proven track record for building and motivating teams to reach their potential
  • You lean on collaboration and continuous improvement
  • You strongly believe in transparency
  • You believe failure is a part of learning
  • You know how to build strong relationships with partners and stakeholders
  • You are familiar with Resilience and Reliability concepts

What you’ll do:

  • Create an environment where different backgrounds, cultures, industry and life experiences are embraced and valued
  • Create and promote a great work environment and positive team culture Build an exceptional team by recruiting, evaluating, and hiring stunning colleagues
  • Partner with the Resilience team engineers to create direction for the team and a plan that can be delivered on and iterated on as things change
  • Create strong partnerships to drive cross-functional projects forward
  • Influence experimentation infrastructure design and development to deliver trusted functionality serving a wide variety of use cases
  • Define a roadmap and execution strategy in collaboration with peer engineering teams, partners, and product management teams
