postings.text: Senior Site Reliability Engineer, Open Connect
postings.description:
The Netflix Open Connect Content Delivery Network is our in-house custom built network and server infrastructure responsible for streaming all of your favorite movies and series.  We strive to deliver a great Netflix viewing experience in over 190 countries so our customers can watch whatever, whenever, interruption free.  We are seeking seasoned Reliability Engineers with extensive experience in *nix, networking, data analysis and large-scale service operations experience to design, scale, operate, automate, and analyze our globally distributed CDN.  Come join us and play a meaningful role in transforming Internet TV!

Responsibilities:

  • Provide technical design, deployment and engineering assistance to ISP partners to integrate our Open Connect Appliances
  • Aggregate, analyze, and correlate large amounts of server and application performance data. Use the innovative Netflix Big Data platform as a highly flexible, specialized and efficient toolset for service delivery optimization and system reliability improvements
  • Drive continual improvement in monitoring, configuration management, instrumentation and automation with the primary goal to maintain highly scalable and reliable CDN services worldwide
  • Handle Tier 3 escalation for service delivery production issues
  • Have lots of discussions about all the great content and your favorite movies and series

Qualifications:

  • Service Reliability/Operational experience running large scale high performance systems & Internet services
  • Knowledge of and proven experience with CDNs and HTTP cache/proxy technologies
  • Expert-level knowledge of Unix or Linux system administration at scale. We happen to use FreeBSD
  • Strong scripting and automation skills (Python, Perl, Go)
  • Knowledge of networking concepts and application protocols, especially TCP/IP, BGP, HTTP/S and DNS
  • Experience with orchestration container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Some experience with distributed analytic processing technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, Presto, MapReduce, etc)
  • Ability to work in a highly collaborative environment and to communicate effectively with internal and external partners
  • Preferred - BS in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering (or equivalent professional experience)

Check out:

  • How Netflix Works With ISPs Around the Globe to Deliver a Great Viewing Experience
  • Serving 100 Gbps from an Open Connect Appliance
  • Netflix Culture

postings.text: Senior Data Engineer, Content Knowledge Graph
postings.description:
Netflix is the world's leading internet streaming service with over 209 million members in 190 countries. Our members enjoy a wide variety of streamed video per day, using over 1000 types of devices, generating more than a third of downstream Internet traffic in North America. The Content Knowledge Graph team within Data Science & Engineering is based in the entertainment capital of the world and is passionate about providing our colleagues with rich data. Our charter is to map the world’s content. Data from our knowledge graph improves the efficiency of content decision-making by enabling teams to rapidly experiment while helping Netflix drive towards its  goal of “entertaining the world”.

In this role, you will partner closely with other engineers and scientists to accelerate research, drive experimentation, create analytical data products and machine learning models. This is an opportunity for someone with a strong data engineering background to demonstrate their thought leadership in crafting metrics and elegant insights that have a direct impact on the business.

Challenges you’ll tackle:

  • Own mission-critical portions of Netflix's graph data model. Collaborate with partners to understand needs, model data using relational and graph warehouse standard methodologies, and develop pipelines to ensure the timely delivery of high-quality data.
  • Continually acquire and ingest valuable data sources. Build new and improve existing ETLs that help us expand our understanding of the content universe. 
  • Collaborate with business partners to develop analytics and metrics to grow understanding of our data and content. Creatively explore how to use large-scale networks of data to translate and answer complex data questions using flexible methodologies.

About you:

  • You are excited about building the world’s largest content knowledge graph. Energized by the ability to explore graph data modeling and warehousing.
  • You bring a product mindset to understand business needs, and come up with scalable data engineering solutions. 
  • You are nimble and take smart risks, have an eye for detail, and love to spark joy amongst your partners with high-quality data products that are well documented, modeled, and easy to understand. 
  • You have strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional partners on projects to drive high impact outcomes.
  • You excel in at least one major language (e.g., Python, Scala, Java), write great SQL (any variant), and are comfortable with ETL tech (e.g., Spark); expect to work in a distributed environment.
  • You have experience with MPP/Cloud data warehouse solutions (Hive, Iceberg, Snowflake, Redshift, BigQuery, Vertica, Teradata, Greenplum, etc.).
  • Any experience with graph databases (Amazon Neptune, Neo4J, TigerGraph), graph query languages (Gremlin, SPARQL, Cypher), or graph data models (RDF, Property) is a plus!
Netflix offers amazing co-workers, new technology, fascinating analytical and technical challenges, and a Freedom & Responsibility Culture that's truly outstanding. It’s worth learning more: http://jobs.netflix.com/culture

postings.text: Technical Program Manager - Platform Engineering
postings.description:
About Netflix:
Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 209 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any Internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.

About Platform Engineering:
Our purpose is to enable Netflix to scale effectively and empower our technical talent to focus on building innovative experiences for our members, partners, and creators around the world. We do this by providing a highly available, reliable, secure, compliant, and performant platform of data, software, and infrastructure solutions that:

- meet the needs of our growing business
- accelerate the productivity of Netflix engineers, scientists, and data users
- maintains cost-efficiency that is at most linear to the growth of our business

We are looking for a Technical Program Manager for the Platform Engineering organization that will be focused on large cross-functional programs that impact almost all of engineering at Netflix. This individual will partner closely with product management, engineering managers, and other technical program managers to execute and align on programs.

What you will do

  • Lead multiple cross-functional programs, in collaboration with technical teams (including product, engineering, UI/UX, Data Science, etc), that focus on building a scalable, reliable, and secure infrastructure foundation
  • Leverage deep technical domain expertise to drive technical strategy, planning, and execution with engineering partners
  • Craft and drive engagement with partners, work to decompose requirements into technical execution plans with multiple engineering teams, track progress towards goals, and report status to product, customers, and technical leadership
  • Champion breaking out OKRs into measurable milestones while proactively managing risks, blockers, and delays
  • Manage cross-functional dependencies, risks, and changes effectively by optimizing scope, schedule, and resources accordingly

What we are looking for: Functional Skills

  • You can partner with multiple cross-functional teams to define technical strategy and requirements
  • You are highly skilled, experienced, and enjoy orchestrating programs with many moving parts - people, needs, and technologies
  • You have an ability to identify gaps in solutions, debate technical approaches, and weigh in on product vs technology tradeoffs
  • You aren’t afraid to get your hands dirty, pulling data to provide insight, debug issues, and monitor system health
  • You have a data-driven mindset in your decision making
  • You have a deep understanding and point of view within your technical domain(s) of expertise
  • You have domain expertise in one of the following areas: cloud infrastructure, engineering productivity, or data

What we are looking for: Basic Qualifications

  • 10+ years of experience driving large scale SW projects with engineering and product teams4+ years of software engineering, systems engineering, or technical product/program management experience
  • Experience managing projects across cross-functional teams, building sustainable processes and coordinating release schedules 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, including clear articulation of business impact and technical constraints tailored to the audience
  • Self-starter who enjoys tackling 0 to 1 problem spaces and quickly bringing organization and direction

Additive qualifications

  • Experience in platform infrastructure platforms - either developer productivity, Reliability tools, and/or AWS cloud infrastructure - storage, compute, networking
  • Migration experience moving from on-prem to cloud architecture 
  • Data security/privacy architecture understanding

postings.text: Director of Technical Program Management, Engineering
postings.description:
The Engineering Sr. Technical Program Manager, is a senior leader in the Engineering organization, who will function as a strategic partner to the VP of Engineering to maximize business outcomes across the two thousand person engineering organization at Netflix. They will establish rhythm of the business practices and maximize performance through strong execution. Additionally, they will oversee cross-functional, organization-wide projects or initiatives, bringing together multiple stakeholders to help drive decisions and ensure alignment.

Roles & Responsibilities

  • Develop and align with stakeholders on Engineering strategies.
  • Drive strategic, cross functional initiatives such as preparing for quarterly business reviews, long-term vision/roadmap planning, facilitating program review meetings around key engineering wide initiatives.
  • Establish and drive alignment and reporting around top line engineering metrics. 
  • Help with VP’s communication up, down and sideways by aligning on structured and predictable ways for her to engage through different communication channels and owning the rhythm. 
  • Examples include: maintaining a public engineering calendar with key dates throughout the year, driving a communication cadence of email/All Hands, etc. facilitating engineering wide surveys, collating feedback, next steps.
  • Work with the VP’s direct reports, VPs, HRBPs, and Talent partners to identify, surface, and execute on key areas of culture investment and organizational change. Examples include employee growth and development, leadership expectations, mentorship programs.
  • Work with key partners in Recruiting to ensure that Recruiting is aligned on hiring priorities and we have effective reporting and accountability structures.

Qualifications

  • 12+ years experience; background in top tier management consulting and/or program/product management in a high growth technology organization strongly preferred.
  • Awareness of technical challenges and understanding of how large engineering organizations operate.
  • Creative problem solving (i.e., excels at identifying trends and patterns, developing root cause analysis, and using a diverse toolkit to diagnose problems).
  • Ability to build rapport and influence quickly, both internally and externally.
  • Strong engineering and product acumen. Demonstrated experience leading high-impact projects for the business at scale, especially those which innovate, improve business execution, and/or span multiple products and teams. 
  • Structured thinker; good at framing decisions and unearthing critical logic.
  • Ability to develop strategic plans and organize projects across multiple teams and business functions.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to represent and showcase complex business or technical concepts with senior leadership.
  • Excellent time management, intentional prioritization and documentation skills required.
  • Bachelor’s or Masters’ Degree in Business, Engineering, Technology, or related field or equivalent experience.
  • Strong understanding of the software development life cycle.

postings.text: Director of Product Management, Promotional Media Algorithms
postings.description:
The Role : It’s an amazing time to be joining Netflix as we continue to transform entertainment around the world. We deliver billions of hours of movies and TV shows per month to more than 200 million members in over 190 countries. We are creating original content at an unprecedented scale, and have become the largest studio in the world. 

Studio Algorithms sits at the intersection of Consumer Experience and the Netflix Studio. We are connecting cutting edge computer vision, machine learning, and computer graphics algorithms to great member experience and business values. We lead algorithm-centered innovation projects but also partner across the company to scale Netflix Studio, improve our content’s creative excellence, and innovate the way storytellers and creative artists work. We influence, educate, and advocate on tactical product decisions as well as the strategic directions to enable the next slate of great product innovations in this space.

As Director of Product Management for Promotion Media Algorithms, you will be part of the Studio Algorithms team and work closely with a team of world-class scientists, researchers, and engineers, global and regional business stakeholders, and other Studio product management, design, consumer insights, and operational talents to build algo-driven or assisted artist tools, and improve the effectiveness of creative copy, artwork, and video assets. In success, these tools will be intuitive to use and partially automate repetitive tasks while giving artists control over the output; thus allowing them to focus on the more creative aspects of their work. They will also leverage past data and insights along with our personalization systems to empower better creative decisions and produce and distribute more effective assets to help our members and prospective members discover and enjoy our brand and titles. 

A successful candidate will combine a deep technical background in e.g. computer vision, machine learning, with a strong product sense, exceptional cross-functional leadership and communication skills, a hypothesis-driven mentality, sharp business acumen, creativity and courage to look at problems in new ways, to define, inspire, explain, and execute his/her vision. 

What will you do?

  • Craft and communicate a strategic vision and roadmap in building products and tools powered by computer vision, machine learning and graphics algorithms to increase artist productivity and allow them to focus on the creative aspects of their work, as well as improve the performance and effectiveness of creative outcomes. 
  • Partner closely with business stakeholders and relevant product and engineering teams to integrate work outputs into the content and asset production workflows.
  • Work with senior management and executives to develop the vision for a data-driven Netflix Studio.
  • Partner with the algorithm research team to point them toward business problems that could be well-solved through advancements in the state-of-the-art and then manage the “technology transfer” from the resulting work into new products and tools. 
  • Be an advocate for new technologies with artists and an advocate for artist experience with scientists and engineers working.
  • Mentor and coach senior product managers. 
  • Connect advances in computer vision with opportunities to solve new problems in this space. 
  • Foster an inclusive environment, where all viewpoints are welcomed and encouraged.
  • Think broadly about the Netflix business and contribute to efforts beyond your domain.

What we offer

  • Opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way. The Netflix product management model is different from most technology companies. Our key product management leaders - including this position - work with multiple sprint teams but do not have direct reports. Consequently, we’re looking for experienced product leaders who are strategic and also like rolling up their sleeves. 
  • Responsibility. Netflix offers true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate.
  • Freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence in a fast paced, exciting environment. 
  • Work with smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. 
  • A work environment where you can grow your career. Many of our top execs started out as individual contributors.

What are we looking for?

  • Proven record of successfully building and launching great products or platforms that have a significant algorithmic component and strategic ability to incorporate larger business context into algorithm development.
  • Extensive experience and demonstrated leadership working effectively with data scientists, machine learning engineers, etc. 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to present technical content to diverse non-technical audiences. 
  • Ability to partner with people from different parts of the company, in roles with grey areas in authority, to ensure that your solutions drive real business impact. 
  • Ability to prioritize well, manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision. 
  • 5+ years experience in product management with a proven record of successfully launching products, or platforms. Preferably with experience leading enterprise or studio products. 
  • Proven track record of technical product innovation, identifying new opportunities and building them to scale. 
  • 5+ years of education and/or industry experience in an area related to computer vision and machine learning
  • Post graduate education (MS or PhD)  in a applied quantitative field such as : Machine learning, Computer Science, Operations Research, Math, Physics, Engineering, Economics or Statistics
  • Exposure to the entertainment industry, or related products and solutions in the past is a huge plus.
We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

  • Connect advances in computer vision with opportunities to solve new problems in this space. 
  • Foster an inclusive environment, where all viewpoints are welcomed and encouraged.
  • Think broadly about the Netflix business and contribute to efforts beyond your domain.
    • What we offer
  • Opportunity to impact the business in a meaningful way. The Netflix product management model is different from most technology companies. Our key product management leaders - including this position - work with multiple sprint teams but do not have direct reports. Consequently, we’re looking for experienced product leaders who are strategic and also like rolling up their sleeves. 
  • Responsibility. Netflix offers true transparency and autonomy. Our culture is unique and is key to how we innovate.
  • Freedom to innovate, solve interesting problems and influence in a fast paced, exciting environment. 
  • Work with smart people who love to solve hard problems, and who not only expect but also foster high performance. 
  • A work environment where you can grow your career. Many of our top execs started out as individual contributors.
    • What are we looking for?
  • Proven record of successfully building and launching great products or platforms that have a significant algorithmic component and strategic ability to incorporate larger business context into algorithm development.
  • Extensive experience and demonstrated leadership working effectively with data scientists, machine learning engineers, etc. 
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and ability to present technical content to diverse non-technical audiences. 
  • Ability to partner with people from different parts of the company, in roles with grey areas in authority, to ensure that your solutions drive real business impact. 
  • Ability to prioritize well, manage a portfolio of bigger and smaller bets while balancing short-term goals and long-term vision. 
  • 5+ years experience in product management with a proven record of successfully launching products, or platforms. Preferably with experience leading enterprise or studio products. 
  • Proven track record of technical product innovation, identifying new opportunities and building them to scale. 
  • 5+ years of education and/or industry experience in an area related to computer vision and machine learning
  • Post graduate education (MS or PhD)  in a applied quantitative field such as : Machine learning, Computer Science, Operations Research, Math, Physics, Engineering, Economics or Statistics
  • Exposure to the entertainment industry, or related products and solutions in the past is a huge plus.
    • We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

postings.text: Director of Engineering, Search & Engagement
postings.description:
About the Team

Netflix is the world's leading streaming entertainment service with over 200 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries, and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause, and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments.
The Search & Engagement team builds the backend systems that help millions of members globally find and discover content they’ll love via Search, Voice UI, and other interactive experiences in the Netflix product. 

About the role

We are looking for a senior engineering leader with great product sense to lead an amazing team of engineers as we scale for continued growth. You will develop a vision for the team, and generate an engineering roadmap to deliver on multiple product and engineering initiatives. You will exemplify the Netflix leadership principles, contribute to our incredible culture, and formulate strong partnerships throughout the company at all levels. In this role, you will be a critical member of the Personalization Application Engineering Leadership team where you will have the opportunity to advise and shape the broader future of Personalization at Netflix.

Responsibilities:

  • Balance multiple business and product priorities to deliver maximal impact.
  • Develop an engineering roadmap that positions our systems for scale and continued innovation.
  • Build a high performing, inclusive, and diverse team of top engineering talent.
  • Build strong and trusting partnerships with Product Managers, Engineering leadership, and Business stakeholders. 
  • Be a role model of the Netflix culture.
  • Contribute, shape, and influence the broader Personalization strategy and goals.
  • Support your team by helping them understand priorities and providing context to help them make better decisions.
  • Drive success in a flat organization with minimal process and a heavy emphasis on individual responsibility.
  • Understand the business and build domain expertise in functions relevant to your systems

Desired Experience:

  • Ability to hire, grow, and retain top engineering talent.
  • Successful track record developing high performing teams capable of solving complex problems and delivering elegant solutions that scale.
  • Experience leading engineering teams and diving into technical details to help the team make decisions that lead to efficient, flexible systems that scale.
  • Executive presence in interactions with senior leadership (VP/C-Staff).
  • You are a strong communicator with exceptional listening skills, and the ability to see the bigger picture and communicate this effectively at all levels.
  • You are a thought partner to your business stakeholders and successfully influence product direction. Your ideas are actively sought out by Product Managers (PMs). You can take a conceptual idea and transform it into an actionable test that is both feasible and meets business needs. 
We look forward to discussing more about Netflix culture, our approach to Inclusion & Diversity and what it's like to work at Netflix.

postings.text: Finance BI Solution Architect
postings.description:
Our goal, at Netflix, is to entertain the world.

We have over 200M members, serve over 190 countries, and will spend over $13 billion on content in 2021. We’re well on our way to achieve our goal, but have a lot of work ahead of us. We’re looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) architect to help build a cohesive financial data solution that will incorporate all aspects of our business, flexibly adapt and evolve as our system and data landscapes change, and empower our partners to put the data in their own hands. If the below describe you, we’d love to hear from you.

Your experience shows that you:

  • Have a deep understanding of finance and can materially contribute to conversations with our accounting and FP&A partners. 
  • Know the month/quarter end close processes and can empathize with what’s painful and important for our partners.
  • Have vast hands-on experience with different ERPs (e.g. Workday, SAP, etc) and BI tools (e.g. Tableau, Microstrategy, Looker, etc).
  • Are a systems-thinker who appreciates and plans for how components impact each other and proactively design accordingly.
  • Understand and have experience with different datastores (e.g. Hive, S3, BigQuery, MySQL, etc) and know how and when to leverage their strengths and trade offs.
  • Bonus points: Deep Workday experience and with hands on knowledge how to maximize its leverage

Your coworkers would describe you as:

  • Clear, concise, and effective in both written and verbal communications.
  • Responsible and take accountability.
  • Excel at working in an environment with lots of context and minimal guidance.
  • Ruthlessly pragmatic and know how to prioritize and have an impact.
  • Have strong convictions and are open to being convinced otherwise.

In this role you’ll:

  • Define, plan and implement a financial data strategy at Netflix, working closely with cross functional partners (software developers, data engineers, data analyst, product managers, and finance partners).
  • Balance short term deliverables to immediately benefit Netflix while building towards the long term vision you and the team create.
  • Learn the ins-and-outs of how Netflix manages money
  • Challenge us to get better while learning from your stunning colleagues to improve yourself
If the above sounds like you, and if you resonate with our unique culture, please apply - we’d love to hear from you!

postings.text: Senior Narrative Designer - Night School Studio
postings.description:
About Our Team
We’re a group of developers, artists, and storytellers that make games full of wonder, danger, and humor. Everyone at our studio, whether an industry vet or new voice impacts each game through collaborative feedback, mutual respect, and creative empowerment. If you want to make games that leave a meaningful impact on players: we want to hear from you.
We’re looking for new teammates who deeply care about the work they do, the stories they tell, and the people they create with. As part of the Netflix team, we strive to hire the best and value integrity, excellence, respect, inclusion, and collaboration.
 
Narrative at Night School Studio
At Night School, narrative is the glue that holds together design and writing. Our team keeps a cohesive vision through constant communication with stakeholders across art, design, engineering, and writing. We are empowered to tell amazing stories, actively contributing to writing dialogue, designing levels, and creating new mechanics. Night School is forging a new path in storytelling and our narrative team is paving the way forward.
 
About the Job
If you're an innate storyteller that loves to collaborate with artists and engineers to tell amazing stories through inventive mechanics: you'll fit right in. Drive the creation of content across multiple disciplines by maintaining the holistic view of our product and distilling it into concise and clear documentation. This is the perfect role for someone looking to collaborate and learn alongside artists, designers, and engineers to produce compelling and memorable narrative.

About you...

  • Passionate about story-telling and interactive media
  • Understands the ins and outs of game design, including level construction, mechanics, and documentation
  • Proficient at communication, negotiation, and diplomacy.
  • Ability to work effectively in a cross-discipline environment
  • Writing skills in game dialogue, cinematics, and prose
  • Experienced in both design and narrative

Responsibilities include...

  • Design and implement creative and engaging narrative moments, dialogue, and cinematics for story-driven games
  • Work with design to define the structural requirements and layout for sections of the game
  • Write and maintain guides and documentation for internal use to increase understanding of the story and design elements across the project
  • Assist in the blockout, prototyping, and iteration of grey-boxes to raise the quality, fidelity, and density of narrative as needed
  • Communicate with multiple stakeholders and identify areas for improvement and support

Skills & requirements:

  • 3+ years of experience in writing and designing narrative games, with a preference for titles with branching narrative and multiple outcomes
  • Willingness to learn and master the in-house tools, workflows, and processes at Night School
  • Passion and understanding of narrative structures and how to apply them in games and other interactive storytelling methods
  • Strong sense of scene pacing and cinematography
  • Able to take direction well, and own and drive tasks when necessary
  • Experience working in Unity
  • Experience writing scripts, barks, cinematics, found narrative, or other forms of interactive storytelling

Nice to haves...

  • Ability to bring diverse perspectives and personal experiences to our team
  • Skills as a 2D or 3D artist
  • Understanding of game development pipelines outside of your discipline
  • Experience in developing and writing emergent narratives
  • Desire to create innovative new ways to tell interactive stories

postings.text: Senior Security Partner, Application Security (Gaming)
postings.description:
At Netflix we do one thing - entertainment - and we aim to do it really well. To accomplish this goal, we must produce, distribute, and stream content at a massive scale. We are now also leaning into a new way to experience entertainment with Netflix Games. We have a strong engineering organization that enables us to achieve business objectives and a unique culture that guides us to operate with “Freedom and Responsibility”. This helps keep engineering velocity high, but also means that our security team needs to operate differently than a traditional security team. Employees have tremendous freedom in their work, along with the corresponding responsibility to do the right thing for Netflix. Instead of controlling engineers with process and security gates, we enable them to build secure code and provide them with adequate security context to make the right decisions for Netflix.

The Application Security (Appsec) organization at Netflix helps secure internally built systems and applications that run the Netflix business and the streaming product. We aren’t your typical Appsec team because we focus our efforts on scalable investments in both our engineering and partnership services. The Appsec Partnerships team is the part of this organization that builds close partnerships with key areas in our engineering ecosystem to identify and drive high impact security initiatives (e.g.: Secure by Default in Developer Productivity tools, Secure Application Gateway for all workforce apps). 

We are hiring for a security partner role to support gaming product development at Netflix. In this role, you will work closely with engineering teams building edge services, platform features and backend infrastructure in support of this new product experience for Netflix subscribers. We are looking for security engineers who can be the voice of security in the gaming initiative and identify the right security investments to help us build a strong security story for the Netflix Gaming experience. You will also leverage your security skills to support the Netflix bug bounty program, participate in our product security incident response efforts and other operational appsec responsibilities. 

Desired background:

  • You have a strong application security background with a focus on scalable approaches to product security. 
  • You have experience with threat modeling, security design reviews, and security architecture. 
  • You have excellent written and verbal communication skills and are able to translate security objectives to engineering team asks. 
  • You have experience partnering with cross-functional teams to deliver widely impactful security initiatives. 
  • You demonstrate excellent judgement in prioritizing security efforts to mitigate the appropriate risks.  
  • M&A (Mergers and Acquisitions) Product Security experience is a plus.

Finally, here’s a few more reasons why we love this work and think that you will too:

  • You will have the opportunity to facilitate impactful security work for the Netflix engineering ecosystem.
  • You will work with an industry leading security team with many opportunities to reduce risks in existing projects and identify new ones.
  • You will have the opportunity to research new ideas and share your ideas across the community.
  • You will work closely with domain experts in diverse areas such as microservices architecture, big data, compute platforms and content delivery networks.
We are looking for thoughtful security professionals who enable our mission and support our culture of freedom and responsibility.  You can learn more about life at Netflix by watching our security talks or exploring our open source work.

postings.text: Specialist, Production Technology & Operations - Non-Fiction
postings.description:
The Role
The Production Technology & Operations team plays an important role in ensuring all Netflix Branded Non-Fiction content created in the US and Canada are delivered to Netflix’s high standards utilizing our delivery and QC ecosystem. With a focus on scalable workflows for vendor onboarding, delivery, technical support and quality control, you will be integral to helping our partner post production vendors and show personnel meet the evolving needs of Netflix. 

As a Specialist, you will become a subject matter expert on our delivery and QC workflows and tools, ensuring the vendors and individuals that are responsible for authoring and delivering launch critical and archival assets are well prepared to meet the needs of Netflix. 

The ideal candidate will have a passion for technical and operational problem solving, deep knowledge of post production workflows and tools, and demonstrate a high level of intellectual curiosity. Additionally, a love of teaching, creating educational material and having empathy for those you interact with who are unfamiliar with the technology will serve you well in this role. 

Training and Onboarding Responsibilities:

  • Build strong operational relationships with external partners - Post Production vendors, Post Supervisors, Producers, and others involved in preparation and delivery of media to Netflix.
  • Act as a key technical and operational advisor for the Netflix internal delivery and Quality Control ecosystem.
  • Onboard and train vendors and show personnel on internal applications and workflows including Original Capture File Delivery (OCF Import), IMF Creation, and internal delivery tools (Backlot / Content Hub / Amazon Snowball), access management (Starship), QC and evaluation (Asset QC), and external delivery solutions (Drives/LTO).
  • Coach vendors into a model of efficient and error-free delivery.
  • Educate internal and external teams on technical specifications and workflows.
  • Develop content for public-facing support in an effort to allow partners to self diagnose and repair problematic assets.

Advise, Strategize, Collaborate:

  • Provide expertise and critical insight for the continued evolution and development of the internal Post Production pipeline, and its respective tools, partnering with internal teams to understand user issues and needed enhancements to minimize support issues, and pinpoint automated workflow efficiencies.
  • Analyze vendor delivery data, with a focus on root-cause analysis, to drive an issue prevention strategy that minimizes support requests relating to the internal delivery ecosystem and specifications.
  • Collaborate with various internal cross functional partners, including post production management, dubbing, globalization, marketing, Product Creative, and Title Operations, with an understanding of the unique considerations non-fiction titles may bring to these teams.
  • Be an escalation point for troubleshooting technical issues related to asset delivery into our Post and VFX tools, IMF authoring, and QC platform
  • Work with external partners to ensure the flow of media assets through the Netflix delivery ecosystem is efficient, secure and optimized, with a key focus on developing and executing best practices between tools.
  • Partner with internal and external Post Production teams to create and execute an efficient Quality Control plan and help evaluate received reports and guide on the implementation of fixes.

Qualifications

  • 7+ years prior experience in a role as a Post Production Workflow Engineer, DI, or QC technician or operational lead for a Production or Post Production facility that specializes in Non-Fiction content is ideal
  • Working knowledge of digital audio and video file formats, preferably experience with IMF, Dolby Atmos, and Dolby Vision workflows including the tools used to create these elements
  • Familiarity with production and post workflows and software such as Shotgun, Blackmagic DaVinci Resolve, Baselight, Avid Media Composer, Adobe Premiere, Clipster, Colorfront Transkoder, Avid Pro Tools
  • Ability to troubleshoot technical errors within various video and audio formats, especially IMF
  • Experience partnering with 3rd party vendors to achieve operational efficiencies
  • Have a data-driven mindset and experience analyzing and learning from data
  • Familiarity with audio, video and data communications protocols as standardized by IETF, SMPTE, ITU and AES
  • Prior experience coaching, mentoring, and/or teaching people how to utilize new tools, software, or workflows
  • Bias to action within an ever evolving environment, with last minute changes and quick turnaround times
  • Ability to organize and prioritize your work without daily oversight
  • Curiosity to learn new technical workflows, standards, and tools
  • Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace

  • Build strong operational relationships with external partners - Post Production vendors, Post Supervisors, Producers, and others involved in preparation and delivery of media to Netflix.
  • Act as a key technical and operational advisor for the Netflix internal delivery and Quality Control ecosystem.
  • Onboard and train vendors and show personnel on internal applications and workflows including Original Capture File Delivery (OCF Import), IMF Creation, and internal delivery tools (Backlot / Content Hub / Amazon Snowball), access management (Starship), QC and evaluation (Asset QC), and external delivery solutions (Drives/LTO).
  • Coach vendors into a model of efficient and error-free delivery.
  • Educate internal and external teams on technical specifications and workflows.
  • Develop content for public-facing support in an effort to allow partners to self diagnose and repair problematic assets.
    • Advise, Strategize, Collaborate:
  • Provide expertise and critical insight for the continued evolution and development of the internal Post Production pipeline, and its respective tools, partnering with internal teams to understand user issues and needed enhancements to minimize support issues, and pinpoint automated workflow efficiencies.
  • Analyze vendor delivery data, with a focus on root-cause analysis, to drive an issue prevention strategy that minimizes support requests relating to the internal delivery ecosystem and specifications.
  • Collaborate with various internal cross functional partners, including post production management, dubbing, globalization, marketing, Product Creative, and Title Operations, with an understanding of the unique considerations non-fiction titles may bring to these teams.
  • Be an escalation point for troubleshooting technical issues related to asset delivery into our Post and VFX tools, IMF authoring, and QC platform
  • Work with external partners to ensure the flow of media assets through the Netflix delivery ecosystem is efficient, secure and optimized, with a key focus on developing and executing best practices between tools.
  • Partner with internal and external Post Production teams to create and execute an efficient Quality Control plan and help evaluate received reports and guide on the implementation of fixes.
    • Qualifications
  • 7+ years prior experience in a role as a Post Production Workflow Engineer, DI, or QC technician or operational lead for a Production or Post Production facility that specializes in Non-Fiction content is ideal
  • Working knowledge of digital audio and video file formats, preferably experience with IMF, Dolby Atmos, and Dolby Vision workflows including the tools used to create these elements
  • Familiarity with production and post workflows and software such as Shotgun, Blackmagic DaVinci Resolve, Baselight, Avid Media Composer, Adobe Premiere, Clipster, Colorfront Transkoder, Avid Pro Tools
  • Ability to troubleshoot technical errors within various video and audio formats, especially IMF
  • Experience partnering with 3rd party vendors to achieve operational efficiencies
  • Have a data-driven mindset and experience analyzing and learning from data
  • Familiarity with audio, video and data communications protocols as standardized by IETF, SMPTE, ITU and AES
  • Prior experience coaching, mentoring, and/or teaching people how to utilize new tools, software, or workflows
  • Bias to action within an ever evolving environment, with last minute changes and quick turnaround times
  • Ability to organize and prioritize your work without daily oversight
  • Curiosity to learn new technical workflows, standards, and tools
  • Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace

postings.text: Product Manager, Cloud Infrastructure
postings.description:
Stories move us. They make us feel more emotion, see new perspectives, and bring us closer to each other. At Netflix, we want to entertain the world and are always looking to help you find your next favorite story.  We currently stream content in more than 30 languages in 190 countries, topping over 200 million paid subscribers.

Our story
Platform engineering is a team of stunning colleagues across the globe focused on providing technical products, tools, and services that enable Netflix to scale and innovate effectively and empower Netflix engineers to focus on building innovative experiences for our members and creators around the world. We deploy hundreds of services, on thousands of instances, across multiple regions, and millions of client devices.  Within Platform Engineering, the teams focused on core infrastructure focus on increasing agility, efficiency, and reliability across our compute, networking, and storage offerings, while reducing operational burden and enabling innovation for application owners.

The Role:
We are looking for an experienced product manager to partner with engineering to build product strategies, prioritized roadmaps, and clear product specifications for core infrastructure on which a majority of the various Netflix businesses run. Product Management is a new team in Platform Engineering and we’re on a mission to raise the level of product thinking across the organization. If you’re looking for a deeply technical and highly dynamic opportunity that will have an outsized impact on the future of software engineering at Netflix, we’d love to talk to you!

What you will do:

  • Develop product roadmaps and specifications across cloud infrastructure offerings that inform engineering teams on objectives, scenario prioritization, and customer requirements,
  • Define longer-term product direction across cloud infrastructure that influences Platform-wide strategy
  • Partner with our customers (other internal Netflix engineering teams), to better understand their problems and work together to deliver needed solutions
  • Partner with other product managers to create cohesive strategies and roadmaps across organizational boundaries
  • Foster an environment that is customer-focused, data driven, and hypothesis/ experimentation based
  • Engage deeply with external communities to stay abreast of industry trends and innovations
  • Help evolve the product management discipline and practices within Platform engineering

What we are looking for:

  • 6+ years of experience in product management
  • A combination of deep technical knowledge and a customer-focused mindset
  • Demonstrated understanding of infrastructure technologies at scale, with deep expertise in one of compute, storage, or networking
  • Experience designing large scale production services in public or private cloud
  • Strategic thinker that can relate technology solutions to customer use cases
  • Comfortable handling and navigating ambiguity, working across different disciplines and teams, and applying a combination of qualitative and quantitative methods to problem solve without perfect metrics
  • Good balance of IQ & EQ to be able to solve both technical and social challenges
  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

Want to know more about our Cloud Infrastructure teams? Check out:

  • Opensourcing Titus
  • Disenchantment: Netflix Titus, Its Feisty Team, and Daemons
  • Evolution of Edge @Netflix
  • Scaling Push Messaging for Millions of Netflix Devices
  • Performance Engineering YouTube channel
A few more things about us:
As a Platform team, we come from many different countries and our fields of education range from the humanities to engineering to computer science. Our team includes product managers, program managers, designers, full stack developers, distributed systems engineers, data scientists and folks have the opportunity to wear different hats, should they choose to. We strongly believe this diversity has helped us build an inclusive and empathetic environment, and are looking forward to adding your perspective to the mix!

Our culture is unique, and we tend to live by our values, so it’s worth learning more about Netflix here.

postings.text: Director, Android Product Engineering
postings.description:
The Android Product Engineering organization is responsible for continuously improving the Netflix Android experience to delight, attract, and retain our members. We are looking for a product-minded engineering leader who is passionate about building great customer experiences and adaptable, inclusive teams. You will be part of a cross-functional group of product managers, designers, data scientists, researchers, and engineers leading the evolution of our Android experiences across the Netflix app and key canvases in our newly-launched games initiative. 

Primary responsibilities

  • You are an experienced engineering leader comfortable with technical details and you use this knowledge to advocate for industry-leading engineering excellence
  • You have a demonstrated understanding of hiring, retaining and growing high performing teams through significant technical and product complexities
  • You’ve partnered closely with cross-functional teams and functions to propose, evolve and deliver large products built by several teams
  • You’ve built and scaled teams responsible for highly visible and fast moving apps which are frequently released to millions of users around the world
  • You have experience leading emerging market offerings, data-driven discussions, large technical infrastructure and product engineering initiatives across multiple teams
  • You are a strong communicator with exceptional listening skills, you can operate independently, challenge the status quo and you always play for the larger team

What sets you apart?

  • You establish and reinforce a clear technical vision with your team. You have experience making smart investments in Android architecture to meet the demands of a rapidly growing user base across the world. You’ve learned the difference between building flexible systems that can adapt to business needs and unnecessarily complex systems that attempt to guess the future. 
  • You have a passion for the customer experience. As the most senior Android engineering voice on the cross-functional product leadership team, you are always thinking about the user experience implications of what your team is experimenting on.
  • You are a thought partner to your business stakeholders and successfully influence product direction. Your ideas are actively sought out by Product Managers (PMs). You can take a conceptual idea and transform it into an actionable test that is both feasible and meets business needs. 
  • You can effectively prioritize and make tough trade-offs. You seek to understand other parts of the business, their limitations, and where product sensitivities lie. You balance competing concerns and make tough calls on where to cut scope vs. invest more heavily, and how to make resourcing trade-offs across multiple PMs.
  • You embrace adaptability and flexibility. You are always looking for creative ways to keep your team nimble, and foster a culture that embraces change. 

What leadership skills are important to us?

  • Strong judgment - a key element of our trust-based culture is relying on leaders to apply good judgment to the numerous decisions across all the areas they’re responsible for. When you make mistakes, you learn from them and transparently share with others so that we all improve and learn.
  • Thoughtful people management - you must be thoughtful and intentional in how you go about identifying, growing and managing the talent on your team. This includes both IC engineers and engineering managers.
  • Inclusion and empathy - your direct team and cross-functional partners come from a wide variety of backgrounds and cultures. As the leader of the team, you set the standard for inclusivity on multiple dimensions, and lead with empathy to help your team work through challenging situations both professionally and personally. 
  • Clear communication - clear and direct written and verbal communication are a must for any leader at Netflix, and especially so for senior leaders. You can take complex concepts and succinctly reframe them so that different audiences can engage and understand. 

Meet the team

  • View the team’s presentation on who they are and what they do (Haiyan)
  • Read about how we migrated our Android endpoints out of a monolith into a new microservice (Rohan and Ed)
  • See one of our pull requests for Epoxy (Emmanuel)
  • Read our take on Rx onError Guidelines (Ed)
  • See some of our work highlighted at a Netflix Women In Tech Event
About Us
Netflix is a global entertainment company with over 200M members across more than190 countries around the world. The mobile team’s goal is to make sure our members have something to watch or play on Netflix whenever, and wherever, they want to. Our freedom & responsibility culture isn’t just a memo, but something we practice daily.

postings.text: Coordinator VFX, UK
postings.description:
The Opportunity

We are seeking an experienced individual to join the dynamic UK VFX Team in London as a VFX Coordinator. This position will act both independently and work closely with the VFX Manager to provide support to them and the wider team across non-fiction, series and film. They will be responsible for a variety of duties using both internal and industry-standard tools, handling vital information, communication and workflows across the lifecycle of VFX production from development through to wrap, and supporting projects with our cross-functional teams within Netflix.

The Role

A successful candidate will need significant experience, and passion, within the Film & Television VFX sector at Senior Coordinator or Line Producer / Production Manager level. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organisation and unwavering attention to detail at all times.  They will need to be solutions-oriented, a positive-thinker, able to exercise good judgment and have excellent communication skills.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Working with the VFX  Manager to serve as a VFX point of contact across pre­-production, production and post production. 
  • Work with cross-­functional teams at Netflix (Creative, Production Management, Post Production, Finance, Tax, Business and Legal Affairs) to ensure productions are successfully set-up and positioned for success.
  • Assist the VFX Manager in the assessment of initial VFX production and post-production plans to ensure each production has the appropriate resources to deliver visual effects of the highest quality. 
  • Alongside the VFX Manager assist in the tracking, managing and reporting of financial and status updates.
  • Serve as a bridge between productions and internal Netflix teams to ensure both sides receive pertinent updates throughout the production lifecycle and resolve any issues in a timely manner.­­
  • Championing, facilitating and contributing to the evolution and adoption of new tools, including Netflix proprietary apps, and determine how to incorporate these into VFX workflows­ and to train their teammates Facilitate the onboarding process for our external partners and crews to the Netflix ecosystem, tools and resources.
  • Update and proactively maintain inward and outward-facing VFX resources and documents.
  • Maintain up-to-date talent and vendor lists and seek to forge new relationships working to Netflix Grow Creative to source and nurture the next generation of talent through training and education opportunities.
  • Set up and manage VFX reviews and note taking through tools such as ShotGrid, cineSync and SyncSketch.

Qualifications and Experience:

  • A minimum of 3 years of experience working in VFX within a medium to high-budget studio, vendor, or VFX production team.
  • The ideal candidate will have held a significant position at Senior Coordinator level or above with one or more vendors. Client-side production experience would be a plus.
  • They need to be passionate about our culture and values in the workplace.
  • Ability to handle a fast-paced environment, simultaneously managing several projects in various stages of production (from development through delivery).
  • Strong organisational skills with a proactive mentality and a strong problem solver, excellent time-management and communication is a must.
  • Familiarity with standard production and post software such as ShotGrid, PIX and cineSync.
  • Knowledge of digital video and audio file formats.
  • Working knowledge of VFX and Post vendors, including digital labs and DI facilities.
  • Highly organised, efficient and detail-oriented.
  • Comfortable with a fast pace and constant change.
  • Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters.
  • Team-player who operates in a fast-paced team-oriented setting.
  • A second or additional language would be a plus.

This position will act both independently and work closely with the VFX Manager to provide support to them and the wider team across non-fiction, series and film. They will be responsible for a variety of duties using both internal and industry-standard tools, handling vital information, communication and workflows across the lifecycle of VFX production from development through to wrap, and supporting projects with our cross-functional teams within Netflix. The Role A successful candidate will need significant experience, and passion, within the Film & Television VFX sector at Senior Coordinator or Line Producer / Production Manager level. This is a demanding and fast-moving position that requires someone who is self-motivated, proactive, quick-thinking, flexible, thorough and able to juggle multiple and diverse responsibilities with a strong emphasis on organisation and unwavering attention to detail at all times.  They will need to be solutions-oriented, a positive-thinker, able to exercise good judgment and have excellent communication skills. Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
  • Working with the VFX  Manager to serve as a VFX point of contact across pre­-production, production and post production. 
  • Work with cross-­functional teams at Netflix (Creative, Production Management, Post Production, Finance, Tax, Business and Legal Affairs) to ensure productions are successfully set-up and positioned for success.
  • Assist the VFX Manager in the assessment of initial VFX production and post-production plans to ensure each production has the appropriate resources to deliver visual effects of the highest quality. 
  • Alongside the VFX Manager assist in the tracking, managing and reporting of financial and status updates.
  • Serve as a bridge between productions and internal Netflix teams to ensure both sides receive pertinent updates throughout the production lifecycle and resolve any issues in a timely manner.­­
  • Championing, facilitating and contributing to the evolution and adoption of new tools, including Netflix proprietary apps, and determine how to incorporate these into VFX workflows­ and to train their teammates Facilitate the onboarding process for our external partners and crews to the Netflix ecosystem, tools and resources.
  • Update and proactively maintain inward and outward-facing VFX resources and documents.
  • Maintain up-to-date talent and vendor lists and seek to forge new relationships working to Netflix Grow Creative to source and nurture the next generation of talent through training and education opportunities.
  • Set up and manage VFX reviews and note taking through tools such as ShotGrid, cineSync and SyncSketch.
    • Qualifications and Experience:
  • A minimum of 3 years of experience working in VFX within a medium to high-budget studio, vendor, or VFX production team.
  • The ideal candidate will have held a significant position at Senior Coordinator level or above with one or more vendors. Client-side production experience would be a plus.
  • They need to be passionate about our culture and values in the workplace.
  • Ability to handle a fast-paced environment, simultaneously managing several projects in various stages of production (from development through delivery).
  • Strong organisational skills with a proactive mentality and a strong problem solver, excellent time-management and communication is a must.
  • Familiarity with standard production and post software such as ShotGrid, PIX and cineSync.
  • Knowledge of digital video and audio file formats.
  • Working knowledge of VFX and Post vendors, including digital labs and DI facilities.
  • Highly organised, efficient and detail-oriented.
  • Comfortable with a fast pace and constant change.
  • Ability to respond after hours for important, timely or urgent matters.
  • Team-player who operates in a fast-paced team-oriented setting.
  • A second or additional language would be a plus.

postings.text: Specialist, Production Technology & Operations
postings.description:
The Role:
At Netflix, the Post Production Technical Operations team is essential to providing our members with a great experience every time they play our content by ensuring the content delivered to the service is of the highest quality. As we continue to expand globally, our role is to maintain and elevate the high-quality standards for our customers by focusing on removing friction from the post production asset lifecycle to improve delivery and quality at scale.
This Specialist will act as a subject matter expert for both internal and external partners who are creating and delivering content. You will build scalable optimized workflows based on the analysis of key metrics and data driving issue prevention and training strategies for the internal delivery and QC ecosystem.

The ideal candidate will have a passion for technical and operational problem solving, deep knowledge of the post industry, and demonstrate a high level of intellectual curiosity. Additionally, a love of teaching and having empathy for those you interact with who are unfamiliar with the technology will serve you well in this role. 

Responsibilities:

  • Partner Evaluation:
    • *Collaboratively evaluate partners and collect key information on a variety of areas including technical infrastructure, Post Production workflows, and mastery of the Netflix deliverables and Quality Control standards.
    *Analyze partner delivery data to drive training and support initiatives improving key partner performance metrics.
    *Provide solutions for metrics-driven analysis of partners' performance to internal teams.

  • Training and Onboarding:
    • *Build strong operational relationships with Post Production, VFX, and Music Partners you support, and act as a key technical and operations contact for the Netflix internal delivery and Quality Control ecosystem.
    *Onboard and train partners on internal applications and workflows including Original Capture File Delivery (Asset  Import), IMF Creation, and internal delivery tools (Backlot/Content Hub/ Amazon Snowball), access management (Starship), QC and evaluation (Asset QC), and external delivery solutions (Drives/LTO).
    *Coach partners into a model of efficient and error-free delivery.
    *Participate in industry events, advocating for Netflix workflows and standards, including programming technical seminars and presentations for the optimization of QC and delivery.
    *Educate internal teams on technical specifications and workflows.
    *Develop content for public-facing support in an effort to allow partners to self-diagnose and repair problematic assets.

  • Advise, Strategize, Collaborate:
    • *Provide expertise and critical insight for the continued evolution and development of the internal Post Production supply chain, and its respective tools, partnering with internal teams to feedback user issues and needed enhancements to minimize support issues and pinpoint automated workflow efficiencies.
    *Analyze vendor delivery data, with a focus on root-cause analysis, to drive an issue prevention strategy that minimizes support requests relating to the internal delivery ecosystem and specifications.
    *Be an escalation point for troubleshooting technical issues related to asset delivery into our Post and VFX tools, IMF mastering, and QC raised by our partners.
    *Work with external partners to ensure the flow of media assets through the Netflix delivery ecosystem is efficient, secure, and optimized, with a key focus on developing and executing best practices between tools.
    *Partner with internal and external Post Production teams to create and execute an efficient Quality Control plan and help evaluate received reports and guide on the implementation of fixes.
    *Build and leverage strong relationships with the global Netflix Post Production teams and external facility vendor managers.
    *Collaborate with internal cross-functional teams on improvement initiatives to streamline our processes.

Qualifications:

  • 10 years prior experience in a role as a Workflow Engineer, Data IO and Archive, DI, or QC technician or lead for a Production facility, Broadcaster or Post Production facility.
  • Knowledge of digital audio and video file formats, preferably experience with IMF, Dolby Atmos, and Dolby Vision workflows including the mastering tools used to create these elements.
  • Familiarity with production and post software such as Blackmagic Resolve, Avid Media Composer, Adobe Premiere, Clipster, Colorfront Transkoder, Shotgun, Pix, Baselight, Pro Tools, Nuendo, Pyramix, or MTI Cortex.
  • Familiarity with audio, video and data communications protocols as standardized by IETF, SMPTE, ITU and AES.
  • Working knowledge of the local and regional Post Production industry
  • Highly organized, efficient, empathetic, and detail-oriented
  • Have a data-driven mindset and experience analyzing and learning from data
  • Strives in a fast-paced, ever-changing environment
  • Prior experience coaching, mentoring, and teaching people how to utilize industry-specific tools and software
  • Passion for technical quality and the ability to contextually identify technical errors within a given image or piece of audio
  • Desire to learn new technical workflows, standards, and tools
  • Local vendor knowledge in the UK.
  • Fluent or business proficiency in English.
  • Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace

postings.text: Specialist, Production Technology & Operations - Animation
postings.description:
The Role

The Production Technology & Operations team plays an important role in ensuring all Netflix Branded animated content created in the US and Canada are delivered to Netflix’s high standards utilizing our delivery and QC ecosystem. With a focus on scalable workflows for vendor onboarding, delivery, technical support and quality control, you will be integral to helping our partner post production vendors and show personnel meet the evolving needs of Netflix. 

As a Specialist, you will become a subject matter expert of our delivery and QC workflows and tools, ensuring the vendors and individuals that are responsible for mastering and delivering final and archive content are well prepared to meet the needs of Netflix. 

The ideal candidate will have a passion for technical and operational problem solving, deep knowledge of post production workflows and tools, and demonstrate a high level of intellectual curiosity. Additionally, a love of teaching, creating educational material and having empathy for those you interact with who are unfamiliar with the technology will serve you well in this role. 


Responsibilities

Training and Onboarding:

  • Build strong operational relationships with external partners - Post Production vendors, Post Supervisors, Producers, Editorial, and others involved in preparation and delivery of media to Netflix.
  • Act as a key technical and operational advisor for the Netflix internal delivery and Quality Control ecosystem.
  • Onboard and train vendors and show personnel on internal applications and workflows including Original Capture File Delivery (OCF Import), IMF Creation, and internal delivery tools (Backlot / Content Hub / Amazon Snowball), access management (Starship), QC and evaluation (Asset QC), and external delivery solutions (Drives/LTO).
  • Coach vendors into a model of efficient and error-free delivery.
  • Educate internal teams on technical specifications and workflows.
  • Develop content for public-facing support in an effort to allow partners to self diagnose and repair problematic assets.

Advise, Strategize, Collaborate:

  • Provide expertise and critical insight for the continued evolution of the internal Post Production and Netflix Animation Studio pipeline, including its respective tools. Partner with internal teams to identify user issues and needed enhancements to minimize support issues, as well as pinpoint automated workflow efficiencies.
  • Collaborate with various internal cross functional partners, including dubbing, globalization, marketing, Product Creative, and Title Operations, with an understanding of the unique considerations animated titles may bring to these teams.
  • Analyze vendor delivery data, with a focus on root-cause analysis, to drive an issue prevention strategy that minimizes support requests relating to the internal delivery ecosystem and specifications.
  • Be an escalation point for troubleshooting technical issues related to asset delivery into our Post and VFX tools, IMF mastering, and QC platform.
  • Work with external partners to ensure the flow of media assets through the Netflix delivery ecosystem is efficient, secure and optimized, with a key focus on developing and executing best practices between tools.
  • Partner with internal and external Post Production teams, as well as the Netflix Animation Studio, to execute an efficient Quality Control plan and help evaluate received reports, plus guide on the implementation of fixes.

Qualifications

  • 7+ years prior experience on animated titles, in a role as a Post Production Workflow Engineer, DI Producer, DI Technician, Online Editor, QC technician, or operational lead for a Production or Post Production facility
  • Working knowledge of digital audio and video file formats, preferably experience with IMF, Dolby Atmos, and Dolby Vision workflows General understanding of dubbing and subtitling workflows, with the ability to ensure that deliverables from post partners meet the requirements needed for these teams
  • Familiarity with production, post, and data management software such as Maya, Toon Boom Harmony, Dragonframe, Shotgun, Nuke, Adobe After Effects, Adobe Photoshop, Blackmagic Resolve, Avid Media Composer, Adobe Premiere, Colorfront Transkoder, Pro Tools
  • Ability to troubleshoot technical errors within various video and audio formats, especially IMF
  • Ability to help partners troubleshoot content anomalies, especially those unique to animated titles. Familiarity with Photosensitive Epilepsy Testing is recommended.
  • General understanding of color management and common workflows utilized between 2D, 3D, and stop motion animation
  • Familiarity with best practices around archival of 2D, 3D, and stop motion animation projects
  • Experience partnering with 3rd party vendors to achieve operational efficiencies
  • Have a data-driven mindset and experience analyzing and learning from data
  • Familiarity with audio, video and data communications protocols as standardized by IETF, SMPTE, ITU and AES
  • Prior experience coaching, mentoring, and/or teaching people how to utilize new tools, software, or workflows
  • Bias to action within an ever evolving environment
  • Ability to organize and prioritize your work without daily oversight
  • Curiosity to learn new technical workflows, standards, and tools
  • Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace

  • Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace

postings.text: Specialist, Production Technology & Operations - Korea
postings.description:
Netflix is the world's leading internet entertainment service with over 204 million paid memberships in over 190 countries enjoying TV series, documentaries and feature films across a wide variety of genres and languages. Members can watch as much as they want, anytime, anywhere, on any internet-connected screen. Members can play, pause and resume watching, all without commercials or commitments. With this international expansion and a move into Korean originals, it's a great time to join Netflix.

The Opportunity
At Netflix, the Production Technology & Operations team is essential to providing our members with a great experience every time they play our content by ensuring the content delivered to the service is of the highest quality. As we continue to expand globally, our role is to maintain and elevate the high-quality standards for our customers by focusing on scalable workflows for creation, preservation and presentation at quality.
 
This Specialist will act as a subject matter expert for both internal and external partners who are creating and delivering content. You will build scalable optimized workflows based on the analysis of key metrics and data driving issue prevention and training strategies for the internal delivery and QC ecosystem. The ideal candidate will have a passion for technical and operational problem solving, deep knowledge of the post industry, and demonstrate a high level of intellectual curiosity. Additionally, a love of teaching and having empathy for those you interact with who are unfamiliar with the technology will serve you well in this role. 

Responsibilities:

  • Collaboratively evaluate partners and collect key information on a variety of areas including technical infrastructure, Post Production workflows and mastery of the Netflix deliverables and Quality Control standards.
  • Analyze partner delivery data to drive training and support initiatives improving key partner performance metrics.
  • Provide solutions for metrics-driven analysis of partners' performance to internal teams.
  • Build strong operational relationships with Post Production, VFX, and Music Partners you support, and act as a key technical and operations contact for the Netflix internal delivery and Quality Control ecosystem.
  • Onboard and train partners on internal applications and workflows including Original Capture File Delivery (OCF Import), IMF Creation, and internal delivery tools (Backlot/Content Hub/ Amazon Snowball), access management (Starship), QC and evaluation (Asset QC), and external delivery solutions (Drives/LTO).
  • Coach partners into a model of efficient and error-free delivery.
  • Participate in industry events, advocating for Netflix workflows and standards, including programming technical seminars and presentations for the optimization of QC and delivery.
  • Educate internal teams on technical specifications and workflows.
  • Develop content for public-facing support in an effort to allow partners to self diagnose and repair problematic assets.
  • Provide expertise and critical insight for the continued evolution and development of the internal Post Production supply chain, and its respective tools, partnering with internal teams to feedback user issues and needed enhancements to minimize support issues, and pinpoint automated workflow efficiencies.
  • Analyze vendor delivery data, with a focus on root-cause analysis, to drive an issue prevention strategy that minimizes support requests relating to the internal delivery ecosystem and specifications.
  • Be an escalation point for troubleshooting technical issues related to asset delivery into our Post, and VFX tools, IMF mastering, and QC raised by our partners.
  • Work with external partners to ensure the flow of media assets through the Netflix delivery ecosystem is efficient, secure and optimized, with a key focus on developing and executing best practices between tools.
  • Partner with internal and external Post Production teams to create and execute an efficient Quality Control plan and help evaluate received reports and guide on the implementation of fixes.
  • Build and leverage strong relationships with the global Netflix Post Production teams and external facility vendor managers.
  • Collaborate with internal cross-functional teams on improvement initiatives to streamline our processes.

Qualifications:

  • 10 years prior experience in a role as a Workflow Engineer, Data IO and Archive, DI, or QC technician or lead for a Production facility, Broadcaster or Post Production facility.
  • Knowledge of digital audio and video file formats, preferably experience with IMF, Dolby Atmos, and Dolby Vision workflows including the mastering tools used to create these elements.
  • Familiarity with production and post software such as Shotgun, Pix, Blackmagic Resolve, Baselight, Avid Media Composer, Adobe Premiere, Clipster, Colorfront Transkoder, Pro Tools or MTI Cortex.
  • Familiarity with audio, video and data communications protocols as standardized by IETF, SMPTE, ITU and AES.
  • Working knowledge of the local and regional Post Production industry
  • Highly organized, efficient, empathetic, and detail-oriented
  • Have a data-driven mindset and experience analyzing and learning from data
  • Strives in a fast paced, ever changing environment
  • Prior experience coaching, mentoring, and teaching people how to utilize industry specific tools and software
  • Passion for technical quality and the ability to contextually identify technical errors within a given image or piece of audio
  • Desire to learn new technical workflows, standards, and tools
  • Fluency in English and Korean required  
  • Passionate about our culture and values in the workplace
